AECOM is seeking an Entry Level Biologist to be based in our Mechanicsburg or Williamsport, PA offices.

This position provides unlimited career growth potential while working on an excellent team comprised of a variety of staff and project managers in support of AECOM’s clients. Client projects are currently related to natural gas development, land development, mining/quarrying, transportation, and water resource management.

The work will involve a combination of office and field work and will include: wetland delineation, development of environmental technical documents and permit applications. Abundant opportunities for professional growth and career development. A successful candidate will be able to work well with other staff and is comfortable working in small groups and will utilize these skills to prepare technical reports and interact with Clients and regulatory agency staff.

This position is expected to begin in May 2021.

About AECOM

At AECOM, we believe infrastructure creates opportunity for everyone. Whether it’s improving your commute, keeping the lights on, providing access to clean water or transforming skylines, our work helps people and communities thrive.

We take on the most complex challenges and pioneer innovative, iconic solutions that push the limits of what’s possible – the world’s longest cable-stayed bridge, record-breaking sports events, the largest greenfield port development mega project, life-sustaining disaster recovery programs, and the tallest tower in the Western Hemisphere.

On projects spanning transportation, buildings, water, energy and the environment, we deliver professional services throughout the project lifecycle.

We are proud to be recognized for excellence:
+ Named one of _Fortune_ magazine's "World's Most Admired Companies" for the sixth consecutive year

+ Ranked #1 in _Engineering News-Record_ ’s 2020 “Top 200 Environmental Firms”

+ Ranked #1 in Transportation and General Building in _Engineering News-Record_ ’s 2020 “Top 500 Design Firms”

+ VIQTORY 2020 Military Friendly® Gold Employer

About DCS—Environment

AECOM is the leading, worldwide environmental services provider to industry and government — delivering sustainable energy and environmental solutions to meet compliance, business and operational needs. Our advisory and technical staff deliver specialized solutions to unusual and complex problems facing client projects across the full business life cycle — from asset planning, development and operations, to product integration and facility compliance, to site remediation, restoration, sustainability and reuse, and holistic strategies that improve and modernize next generation energy infrastructure. Our solutions balance complex technical, regulatory, business and stakeholder issues to produce measurable value and cost-saving approaches for our clients.

Our services are delivered by 7,400 responsive environmental professionals around the world. Our global staff has in-depth knowledge of local and regional requirements and broad technical expertise in 60 disciplines. We work together across our global network to bring the best resources, skills and efficiencies to our projects.

Responsibilities will include but may not be limited to the following:

+ Collecting and analyzing biological data to determine natural resource impact.

+ Will specialize in wetland delineation, reporting, and permitting.

+ Writing technical documents and permit applications.

+ May specialize in research centering on particular plants and animals and/or the ecology of these organisms.

+ Position involves a large amount of time in the field – Must be able to walk long distances in rugged terrain and carry up to 50lbs of equipment at times.

+ Overnight travel is required and may be for extended periods of time.

Minimum Requirements

+ Bachelor’s degree in Biology, Environmental Science, Natural Resources, Wildlife Studies or related field _(e.g., ecology, wildlife management, fisheries management, etc.)_

+ Working knowledge of biological principles

+ Valid Driver’s license

Preferred Qualifications

+ Relevant professional work or internship experience

+ General understanding of how to operate Geographic Information Systems (GIS) and a Global Position Systems Unit to navigate and survey areas

+ Proficient use of MS Office, especially Excel and Word

+ Capable of working in small or large groups

+ Capable of delivering high quality technical scientific documentation and reports

+ Understanding of personal role in supporting company services by delivering high-quality work products

+ Ability to interpret data and convey complex thoughts and ideas in clear, concise written and verbal form

Additional Information:
+ This is a seasonal position. Employee will be laid off in the Winter from approximately January 1 through April 1.

+ Travel with little notice is required.

+ This position requires the ability to carry up to 50lbs of equipment as needed, as well as the ability to walk long distances in rugged terrain and sometimes adverse climate and field conditions.

+ Must be able to have a work flexible work schedule with availability to meet priority deadlines outside of normal working hours.

What We Offer

When you join AECOM, you become part of a company that is pioneering the future. Our teams around the world are involved in some of the most cutting-edge and innovative projects and programs of our time, addressing the big challenges of today and shaping the built environment for generations to come. We ensure a workplace that encourages growth, flexibility and creativity, as well as a company culture that champions inclusion, diversity and overall employee well-being through programs supported by company leadership. Our core values define who we are, how we act and what we aspire to, which comes down to not only delivering a better world, but working to “make amazing happen” in each neighborhood, community and city we touch. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in each person’s potential, and we’ll help you reach yours.

Overview:
The role proactively supports Lufkin’s strategy to zero environmental incidents as the Environmental Specialist. This position will be located in Houston TX. The role will report to the Compliance and Programs HSE Manager.
Responsibilities:
Environmental SPOC (Single Point of Contact) (80%):
Member of the HSE Compliance and Programs Team responsible for developing and implementing policies, procedures, projects, and processes in support of the companies environmental strategies, including but not limited to: multi-media compliance, waste management, pollution prevention and waste minimization, permitting assistance, hazardous materials, UST/AST compliance, environmental due diligence and remediation and assistance with other general environmental tasks.
Develop Corporate Environmental Initiatives.
Develop and Measure key metrics that drive the effectiveness of environmental compliance assurance company wide.
Develops HSE strategies to fill compliance and performance gaps.
Establishes effective working relationships with internal partners to identify the current state of Environmental performance, risks, issues, and needs.
Interfaces with industry and environmental groups and regulatory agencies to keep current on the changes developing in the regulations and legislation.
Other duties may include conducting training and auditing, providing technical advice to operations and frontline HSE personnel, interpretation of data, standards, codes, and regulations.
HSE Project Team support (20%)
Work with Global HSE team members and cross-functionally in the development and implementation of the health, safety, and environmental programs to ensure compliance with regulatory statutes, rules / regulations at the federal, state, and local levels.
Supports the development and implementation of the Global HSE Management System,
Design and implement a continuous improvement process into the Environmental Specialist roles and responsibilities.

Bachelor’s degree in environmental science
Minimum of 5 years’ experience in a similar role
In depth knowledge of regulatory requirements, interpretations, and health and safety programs.
Aptitude to solve problems quickly.
Excellent written, communication skills and project management skills are a must.
Ability to travel up to 40% of the working time.
Ability to influence, inspire and motivate people who are not directly under her/his responsibility.
Strong analytical skills and strategic thinking capability.
Lufkin’s proud past extends back to the early 20th century when the Lufkin Foundry manufactured railroad and sawmill equipment. The company expanded soon after by pioneering oilfield pumping units in the 1920s. Today, Lufkin is a world leader in its field, providing precision-engineered oilfield equipment, products, and services to customers around the globe.

company_name: The Port Authority of New York and New Jersey
job_descriptions:
Responsibilities
This position is with the Office of Environmental and Energy Programs, the department that leads Agency sustainability policy, target-setting, reporting, and project/program development and implementation. The Port Authority is the first US transportation agency to align with the Paris Climate Agreement, and this position will play an instrumental role in helping the Agency achieve its climate action ambitions. The Manager, Clean Technology and Innovation (CTI) supporting OEEP in developing and deploying clean energy and technology projects. The Manager, CTI will also lead evaluation and vetting of greenhouse gas-reducing emerging clean technology and solutions and help identify relevant applications for Agency, including alternate project delivery models.
Reporting to the Deputy Director of OEEP, you will have a high level of access and collaboration with the Director of the department, and will be collaborating with other program managers within OEEP in promoting innovation in areas such as alternative fuel vehicles and fueling infrastructure, energy efficiency, renewable energy, smart buildings/smart grid, energy storage, and other clean energy technologies. The Manager, CTI will act as OEEP’s vehicle electrification lead, collaborating with other departments, including Central Automotive Division, Engineering, Finance, and line department staff in Aviation, Tunnels Bridges and Terminals, Ports, PATH and World Trade Center, as well as with external stakeholders.
The Manger, CTI should have experience in project vetting/selection, clean tech/energy deal transactions, and commercial structures in the clean tech/energy space. This is an excellent opportunity for an entrepreneurial candidate seeking to develop and deploy multiple types of energy and greenhouse gas (GHG) reduction projects, and act as an innovation agent within an organization with tremendous potential to advance climate change mitigation and the transition to a low-carbon economy. The Manager, CTI will manage other staff.
This position provides an excellent opportunity for a driven, creative candidate to interface with various Port Authority departments to advance the Agency’s greenhouse gas reduction goals and the roll out of clean energy and technology at the Agency’s NY and NJ facilities.
Responsibilities
Vehicle Electrification and Alternative Fuels
Leads Agency efforts to electrify fleet vehicles
Monitors electric vehicle (EV) policy, market and technology developments
Develops internal policies related to EV infrastructure requirements, EV supply equipment (EVSE) protocols, workplace charging
Supports development of fee structures and business models for public EV charging at Agency parking facilities
Develops and revises Agency electrification roadmap
Evaluates other alternative fuel technology and applications, such as, liquid biofuels, hydrogen, ammonia, CNG, hybrid technologies, power to grid, anaerobic digestion
Evaluates the need for alternate fueling infrastructure
Leads efforts related to developing incentives/policies to support broader regional transition to low/zero-emissions vehicles
Clean Technology and Innovation
Leads evaluation and vetting of GHG-reducing clean tech and relevant applications for Agency, including alternate project delivery models
Works with other teams to promote innovation in renewable energy, energy efficiency, smart buildings/smart grid, and other sustainability programs
Develop/manage clean tech pilot projects and partnerships
Develop business case and vet approaches/opportunities with relevant internal stakeholders
Support development and negotiation of relevant project agreements
Qualifications
Candidates must present the following qualifications to be considered eligible for this position:
Bachelor’s Degree in environmental science, business, engineering, policy or management from an accredited college or university with aptitude in finance, project management, economics or data analytics.
Minimum of 7 years of professional experience in clean technology & energy project development.
Experience in clean technology space, including relevant commercial structures
Desired
Ideal candidates will present the following profile:
Advanced degree in environmental/sustainability policy or management, public administration, engineering, business or related field
Demonstrated familiarity with NY-NJ policy and incentive regime
EV/alternative fueled vehicles and infrastructure deployment
Understanding of alternative fuel technologies and applications
Demonstrated experience in clean tech transactions
Demonstrated management and large organizational experience
Ability to communicate complex topics with senior leadership, line business and facility staff, stakeholders and contractors
Demonstrated quantitative and analytical skills, including performance measurement
Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to work with multiple stakeholders
Excellent written and oral communication skills, including the ability to make concise presentations to a variety of audiences
Demonstrated people management skills
Knowledgeable about transportation related technologies and infrastructure
Experience in climate action and sustainability planning processes
Compensation & Benefits
The Port Authority of New York and New Jersey offers a competitive salary, an outstanding benefits package and a professional environment that supports development and recognizes achievement.
How To Apply
Interested candidates should apply to this job by clicking on the Apply Now button and submitting a combined cover letter and resume. The Port Authority of NY & NJ welcomes veteran and military spouse applications.

Only applicants under consideration will be contacted.
About The Port Authority
Founded in 1921, the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey builds, operates, and maintains many of the most important transportation and trade infrastructure assets in the country. The agency's network of aviation, ground, rail, and seaport facilities is among the busiest in the country, supports more than 550,000 regional jobs, and generates more than $23 billion in annual wages and $80 billion in annual economic activity. The Port Authority also owns and manages the 16-acre World Trade Center site, where the 1,776-foot-tall One World Trade Center is now the tallest skyscraper in the Western Hemisphere.
EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER
The Port Authority of New York & New Jersey/Port Authority Trans-Hudson (PATH) is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

About BCI:
Beyond Campus Innovations Inc. (BCI) is a wholly owned entity of the Colorado State University Foundation. BCI provides online education through partnerships with institutions located in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia providing a Master's program in Business Administration.
BCI is seeking terminally degreed faculty in Management, who are national leaders in their fields of study and who are specially trained to teach adult learners in an online platform, to teach for the Saudi Electronic University (SEU). Previous experience teaching international students (notably Middle Eastern students) is desired. Please note that this is a 100% remote position.
Successful candidates will adhere to all BCI faculty expectations, including but not limited to:
Participating in the online classroom a minimum of five days per week, including one weekend day.
Conducting a minimum of seven live, 2-hour long lectures per term using Blackboard Collaborate.
Grading and providing detailed feedback on all assignments (critical thinking assignments and discussion board) within 72 hours of assignment due date. This includes in-depth feedback on APA format, writing structure, the use of critical thinking skills, and research skills.
Actively responding to student emails and requests within 24 hours.

Skills and Qualifications:
Communicate effectively with students via Blackboard or similar Learning Management System (LMS), including through video updates.
Be a scholar in one or more of the following areas: international management and leadership, international human resources, international operations management, international ethics and sustainability, or international strategic management.
Communicate effectively on business issues and various corporate situations.

Required Experience:
A doctorate in management related discipline or business administration
Minimum 2-3 years teaching online at the college/university level.
Teaching international students.
Management experience in the Middle East a plus.

Additional Information:
BCI/International program courses are 14 weeks in length, currently taught in two sessions per year.
Course appointments are awarded on a term-to-term basis.
Employment is considered part-time/temporary.
Compensation is competitive and is based on student enrollment.
Background checks and reference checks are required of all candidates.

For full consideration, an application must include a cover letter, CV, teaching philosophy, and unofficial graduate transcripts. Your CV should clearly indicate the following information:
Course codes, titles, and dates of college/university courses taught.
Publications listed in APA format.
Dates and titles of conference presentations.
University and community engagement.
International student teaching experience.
Verification of 2-3 years online teaching experience at the college/university level.

Alcoa (NYSE: AA) is a global industry leader in bauxite, alumina and aluminum products, with a strong portfolio of value-added cast and rolled products and substantial energy assets. Alcoa is built on a foundation of strong values and operating excellence dating back nearly 130 years to the world-changing discovery that made aluminum an affordable and vital part of modern life. Since inventing the aluminum industry, and throughout our history, our talented Alcoans have followed on with breakthrough innovations and best practices that have led to efficiency, safety, sustainability and stronger communities wherever we operate.
This position provides high-level executive program support and project coordination for Alcoa Corp’s CEO, the office of the CEO, and the Chief External Affairs Officer. This position manages all aspects of briefing materials preparation for the CEO and knowledge management for External Affairs. This position requires a high degree of sensitivity and discretion in dealing with legal, confidential and proprietary matters, strong understanding of Alcoa Corp’s businesses and internal operations, excellent organization skills and attention to detail, a proactive, customer-focused mentality, proficiency with Microsoft Office, as well as strong collaboration abilities and communications skills.
This position reports to the Director, Strategy & Policy. The job responsibilities of this role will include:
Briefing and Presentation Materials : Prepare reports, briefing materials and trip books for the CEO and senior Alcoa Corp officials, including but not limited to the Chief External Affairs Officer, to ensure they are fully prepared for all internal and external meetings, commitments and travel. Support the CEO and External Affairs in the development of Microsoft PowerPoint presentation materials, charts and graphics as required.
Public Issues, Membership and Board Positions: Support Alcoa’s long-standing and new relationships with organizations in the group’s public affairs portfolio, including major domestic and international trade associations, non-profits and think tanks. Serve as the liaison and primary contact for board engagements (external to Alcoa Corp), membership obligations, and activities of the CEO and External Affairs. Actively represent Alcoa on key associations as designated by the NA/Europe Director of Corporate Affairs.
Government affairs : Support the NA/Europe Director of Corporate affairs in serving as lobbyist and/or for government outreach in the U.S. and oversee political action committee. Support the Director of Policy & Strategy in management of external affairs issues associated with Alcoa’s joint ventures, including day-to-day management of political consultants.
Research and Issue Tracking: Track and conduct research on select current events and company issues of critical importance to the CEO and to External Affairs.
Project Management: Support the CEO and External Affairs department on special projects as required, including board presentation preparation and other similar events and projects. Support content management on the intranet and website as required.
Sustainability : Support the VP Sustainability and on key issues, including governance of association membership, and serve as government affairs representative on social management system implementation team.
About you:
Our values – act with integrity, operate with excellence, care for people – are at the foundation of everything we do. To be successful in this role and to play a part in our ongoing success we desire the following background:
Bachelor’s Degree required, with 5 years of progressively responsible public affairs experience preferred
Experience with US legislative bodies preferred.
Understanding of international relations, politics and trade issues, and business
Previous experience with external and internal relationship management
Excellent communication skills and experience with effective internal and external communication strategies and implementation
Strengths: great teammate, proactive, critical thinking, ability to quickly adjust to change and work stress, solution and customer-service orientation, drive for results
The position will require <25% travel
This position is based in Washington, DC
To support our teams and their families beyond the workplace, Alcoa provides an outstanding benefits package effective day one of employment! In addition to medical benefits, we offer structured work-from-home programs, employee resource group opportunities, 401K options and a first-rate vacation plan for valuable work-life balance.
Alcoa encourages applications from women, people of diverse backgrounds and those with different skills and life experiences. Alcoa is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace.

This role entails delegating and overseeing workflow and successful project execution as a regional, technical, or market sector lead managing high profile clients or projects within our Company. This Job Might Be For You If You Have The Following:

About ILIA
ILIA makes clean skin-centric beauty. We see skincare and makeup as one and believe that skin should look like skin. With transparency as our guide and color as our vehicle, we challenge the conventions of clean beauty to create something radically new, through safe, groundbreaking formulas that protect + revive the skin. Headquartered in Laguna Beach, California, ILIA brings together a strong group of innovative thinkers, rule-breakers and creative problem solvers. We pave the way forward as the leading clean makeup brand in what is being called the Clean Beauty Revolution. Fast paced growth provides constant learning, collaborative teamwork, and the desire to be the best at what you do. We celebrate taking risks and doing what hasn’t been done before.
ILIA is committed to pursuing innovative technology and superior quality, value and service. Our goal is to be the best at what we do, to challenge the impossible by refusing to settle, all while showing respect to our social and physical environments worldwide. In line with that vision, ILIA Is looking for a Sustainability Packaging Engineer to craft and drive a stewardship program that ensures an environmentally conscious and sustainability-driven approach to sourcing and packaging our products.
Role & Responsibilities
Define, measure, track and improve sustainability impacts of material selection, manufacturing processes, recyclability and life cycle of packaging design choices for cosmetics products.
Project Execution - successfully manage and monitor progress to ensure project objectives are delivered on time and within budget.
Partner with outside vendors and internal teams to develop and engineer packages to ensure aesthetic, functional, cost and timing goals are met while delivering a tangible sustainability benefit.
Provide guidance and counsel to creative teams on technical aspects of packaging design and incorporating sustainable materials and solutions.
Develop and maintain a professional knowledge of new or emerging trends in packaging technology with a focus on sustainable materials and recyclability for cosmetics packaging.
Validate the methodology and procedures of suppliers in the fabrication of parts, components, and final assemblies to ensure design goals are met. Will work with suppliers to uncover or troubleshoot errors in the process. Will physically visit suppliers to see the manufacturing line.
Manage new tooling development and validation. Review and approve custom tooling and components for plastic, paper, glass and metal components.
Assess and resolve packaging design problems on existing items.
Take ownership of existing and future technical conceptions; inclusive but not limited to data, consumer complaints, support of quality issues, etc.
Validate first production of primary and secondary packaging as required.
Understand, interpret and challenge technical drawings and tolerances proposed by vendors to achieve product.
Understand plant and contract manufacturing capabilities.
Basic knowledge and use of statistics (i.e. Cp, CpK).
Understand mold functionalities, molding processes, finishing techniques, etc. Evaluate risks and develop clear mitigation plans. Define appropriate testing plan and analyze/interpret results.
Support 10-15 active projects at any time meeting 4-month average timelines from concept to approval.
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in engineering or equivalent technical degree such as chemical or mechanical engineering with packaging experience.
Five years of proven industrial engineering, packaging experience, within Cosmetics or Personal Care categories.
Knowledge of production, manufacturing, product integrity & production cycle timelines
Knowledge of finished goods manufacturing capabilities, supporting necessary line trials, and how the component conception impacts efficiencies of the plant.
PC workstation proficiency; Microsoft WORD, Excel, Outlook. Microsoft Projects a plus, but not required.
Excellent oral and written communication skills.
Detail orientated with strong follow through.
Highly organized and ability to multitask.
This is a full-time, salary position with a competitive benefit package. If this position sounds like a great fit, please email your resume to careers@iliabeauty.com and include the job title you’re applying for in the subject line.

TRC Companies, Inc., a pioneer in groundbreaking scientific and engineering developments since the 1960s, is a national engineering consulting and construction management firm that provides integrated services to the energy, environmental and infrastructure markets. TRC serves a broad range of clients in government and industry, implementing complex projects from initial concept to delivery and operation.
We are seeking an Environmental Analyst who is a strong technical writer and task manager for our West Seneca, Ithaca, Liverpool, or Clifton Park, New York office. This person will support the planning, permitting, and development of projects across New York, with a focus on renewable energy development. This includes the review of regulatory requirements, development of applications and reports to address regulatory requirements, and the support of agency consultation. The successful applicant will be a part of our Permitting, Planning, and Licensing group and part of a dynamic team of scientists, engineers, planners, and other technical specialists in New York. This individual will also have opportunities to support field assignments. Key functions of this position include:
Job Responsibilities:
Preparation of permit applications, environmental documentation, State Environmental Quality Review Act (SEQRA) documentation, and field data reports.
Review of environmental and municipal regulations to identify compliance requirements.
Development of applications for renewable power facilities under Article 10 and/or 94-c
Development of agency consultation packages and coordination with local and regional agencies.
Support public outreach and stakeholder engagement efforts, which may include participation in public meetings and/or open houses.
Support wetland delineations and other biological surveys.
Support proposal development for new opportunities.
Requirements
A Bachelor's degree in environmental science, biology, ecology, botany, forestry, or related field.
3 to 7 years of post-degree experience in environmental consulting related to planning, permitting, or regulatory compliance.
Familiarity with federal and New York State environmental regulations.
Experience supporting power generation, including renewable energy, and energy transmission (e.g. transmission lines or pipelines).
Experience leading a team to execute a task or work scope (e.g., preparation of a permit application package or technical data report).
Excellent technical writing and communication skills, including meeting facilitation.
Ability to maintain a positive attitude during year-round field work.
Ability to participate in meetings with clients or agencies with minimal supervision.
Perform well with minimum supervision.
Preferred Qualifications
Experience managing projects, developing project schedules, and managing project budgets.
Mentoring/training of entry level staff.
Familiarity with GPS and electronic data reporting.
Experience preforming environmental monitoring for construction projects.
Completion of the SWPPP Inspector 4-hour training course.
TRC offers advancement potential and a competitive compensation package including a 401(k) plan with a company match. For more information please visit our website at www.trccompanies.com.

job_title: Part-time, Jr. Graphic Designer, Wonderful Education
job_descriptions:
Company
The Wonderful Company LLC
The Role
Who we are:

We strive to make The Wonderful Company true to its name through our mission to bring positive, multi-generational change to the communities we serve by leveraging our business acumen and hands-on approach to Corporate Social Responsibility. The purpose of our work is to disrupt the cycle of poverty in the Central Valley of California through a relentless focus on the social determinants of health with an unwavering commitment to helping the region's children grow up with better opportunities than their parents had.

Our Central Valley Health & Wellness programs provide completely free comprehensive onsite healthcare to our employees and their families. Our educational programs reach students across 165 schools throughout the Central Valley, with world-class academic initiatives that support them every step of the way, from cradle to career. And our active involvement in the heart of our communities brings infrastructure investments and youth and adult programming that helps build a more vibrant and sustainable society.

Our approach is unique, with our owners personally overseeing these efforts. We are deeply committed to bringing positive, multi-generational change to the communities we serve.

Our work also extends beyond the Central Valley. Giving back and leaving the planet better than we found it will be our legacy. To learn more about our programs and read our entire Corporate Social Responsibility report, click here.

A day in the life at Wonderful:

Being "Wonderful" goes beyond our consumer promise of growing and distributing high-quality fruits, nuts, and other products to customers around the world. We also strive to make The Wonderful Company true to its name through a wide range of philanthropic activities focused on investing in and collaborating with the communities where our employees live and work. We're proud of the difference we've made in the areas of education, community development, health and wellness, and sustainability, particularly in California's Central Valley. Helping tell the story of The Wonderful Company's rich legacy of giving back is where you can play a key role.

We are seeking a part-time Graphic Design Associate to support design needs for Wonderful Education, Wonderful Philanthropy, and Wonderful Health and Wellness. This position will be based in Los Angeles, with travel to the Central Valley of California, as needed.

Please Note: This position is not eligible for relocation. We are only considering applicants who are already local to Los Angeles at this time. Thank you!

Design assets for social media content related to Wonderful Education, Wonderful Health & Wellness, and Wonderful Philanthropy.
From concept to completion, design a broad variety of quick-turnaround marketing assets handled by the internal marketing team that includes but is not limited to; presentations, brochures, posters, email blasts, web graphics, etc.
Perform assigned creative content changes and updates to all marketing materials.
Manipulate graphics as per request (scanning, retouching, color correction, file conversion.)
Solve problems with innovative visual solutions.
Receive direction and feedback from lead Graphic Designer or other team members on required asset creation.
Contribute to team effort by meeting all deadlines with quality work.

Your contribution to Wonderful:

***Please include your portfolio link on your resume***

Formal design training. BA Degree in Graphic Design highly preferred.
Proficiency in the Adobe CS: Photoshop, Illustrator, and InDesign.
An online portfolio that demonstrates the ability to create clean design across a variety of deliverables.
Ability to edit short videos for social/online platforms.
A pulse on social media that will help inform the creation of engaging content.
Must have strong communication, organization, and interpersonal skills.
Ability to work well in a team environment and under the pressure of tight deadlines.
Ability to take a design from concept to production.
A strong work ethic, positive attitude, and high standard for the quality of your work.
Ability to work in a very fast-paced, deadline-driven environment with high accountability for creative standards.
Ability to take a design from conception to production.
High attention to detail.
Graphic Design internship or working experience highly preferred, but not required.
COVID vaccination will be required for this position unless candidate has a legally valid exemption
Location
Home Office
Perks
Headquartered in Los Angeles, The Wonderful Company is a privately held $5 billion company dedicated to harvesting health around the world through its iconic consumer brands. The company's 10,000 employees worldwide are committed to bringing consumers everywhere the freshest, most wholesome pistachios, citrus and pomegranates; bottling the finest water and wines; and creating colorful bouquets that are sure to touch the heart. This commitment is reflected in the company's market share: Wonderful Pistachios® is America's No. 1 tree nut and America's fastest-growing snack; Wonderful® Halos® is the No. 1 mandarin orange in America; POM Wonderful® is the No. 1 100% pomegranate brand in America; FIJI® Water is America's No. 1 premium imported bottled water brand; JUSTIN® Wine has the No. 1 Cabernet Sauvignon in California; and Teleflora® is the world's leading floral delivery service.

The Wonderful Company's connection to consumers has health at its heart and giving back at its core. The company has a long-standing commitment to corporate social responsibility, including more than $1 billion invested in environmental sustainability; $65 million in charitable giving, education initiatives, and innovative health and wellness programs each year; and $143 million toward the construction of two charter school campuses in California's Central Valley.

To learn more about The Wonderful Company, its products and its core values, visit www.wonderful.com, or follow us on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram. To view the current Corporate Social Responsibility report, visit www.wonderful.com/csr.

The Wonderful Company is proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

Microsoft’s Cloud Operations & Innovation (CO+I) is the engine that powers our cloud services. As a CO+I Critical Environment Program Manager (CEPM), you will perform a key role in delivering the core infrastructure and foundational technologies for Microsoft's online services including Bing, Office 365, Xbox, OneDrive, and the Microsoft Azure platform.
Empower Billions!
The Cloud Operations + Innovation (CO+I) business is critical to delivering on this mission and vision, building and operating Microsoft’s cloud infrastructure, which is growing rapidly in response to unprecedented demand for Microsoft services. CO+I operates one of the largest cloud networks on the planet – comprised of more than 160 Datacenters, 130+ edge sites, 2+ million miles of fiber, and millions of servers and network and storage devices.
With environmental sustainability and datacenter optimization at the forefront of our datacenter design and operations, we continue to grow and evolve as we meet the ever-changing business demands that hold Microsoft as a world-class Cloud provider.
Be at the forefront of the action in CO+I as part of our global datacenter operations.
In alignment with our Microsoft values, we are committed to cultivating an inclusive work environment for all employees to positively impact our culture every day.
Responsibilities
As a successful Critical Environment Program Manager (CEPM), your performance objectives will include:
Empower a culture of safety, security, and compliance in all aspect of datacenter activities
Establish and enhance strong working relationships with customers
Oversee the day-to-day operations and maintenance of mechanical and electrical equipment in a datacenter
Ensure that electrical, mechanical, and/or fire/life safety equipment within the datacenter is operating at peak efficiency.
Ensure compliance with infrastructure operations standardization
Act as an escalation point for all facilities-related issues within the datacenter, escalating to the Data Operations Manager as needed. This may include assisting technicians in times of emergencies, job training, and providing input/recommendations on electrical/mechanical design parameters.
Management of small-to-medium projects from conception to completion
Ensure routine reporting for critical infrastructure, inclusive of operational and maintenance KPIs, objectives, organizational polices, procedures, and standards.
Driving cost/energy efficiency projects
Identifying single points-of-failure at regional datacenter locations
Coordinate, plan, schedule, and supervise CE audits and compliance verifications
Drive identification and remediation of vulnerabilities (such as single points of failure). Provide recommendations on new data center equipment designs, technologies, and construction methods. Drive cost/energy efficiency projects
Qualifications
Required Qualifications:
2+ years of relevant work experience in a datacenter or other critical environment with focus on mechanical or electrical maintenance/operations.
Some examples of mechanical equipment in the critical environment may include (but not be limited to): AHUs, CRAHUs, Exhaust Fans, etc.
Some examples of electrical equipment in the critical environment may include (but not be limited to): UPSs, PDUs, Generators, Switchgear, etc.
6 months + of experience working with the operation of building cooling, electrical, mechanical, and life safety systems
6 months + of experience with Electrical Power Monitoring Systems (EPMS), Branch Circuit Monitoring (BCM), and Building Automation Systems (BAS)
High School Diploma or equivalent
Preferred Qualifications:
2+ years of experience with project management or relevant certification/training in project management
Associate’s or bachelor’s degree in applicable engineering field or mechanical or electrical trades
3+ Years’ experience working on large scale projects.
Project Management Institute (PMI) or similar certification
Experience with physical IT infrastructures (e.g. Servers, SANs, Networking, etc.)
