Strong Design sensibilities
Experience in designing ADUs, Custom Homes, and major remodels and additions.
Have worked on fast-paced, deadline-driven projects
Enjoy helping your colleagues and together doing the best work possible
Activities
You will be part of the New Avenue design team and will be assigned to assist on a variety of residential projects throughout the Bay area. On a day to day basis, this could include logging in to our self-developed project management app, following up with client communications, developing project schedules, executing design work, presenting ideas to the internal team and to clients, managing and collaborating with outside consultants, executing design work using Revit and other tools, creating full Construction Documents, and fostering the project through the permitting process. You may also be responsible for construction administration services. Most likely you will be working on a handful of projects at the same time so you must be adept at project management and disciplined in following a strict project schedule by adhering to deadlines and deliverables. With the guidance of our senior design staff, we anticipate your role to eventually grow into a full Project Lead position.

You will be managing your own projects and clients within the NA team under the direction of a senior staff member. This gives you a lot of flexibility and design freedom as well as a lot of responsibility for the success of your projects.
Skills
Requirements:
Autodesk Revit or Revit LT (including phasing, component creation, and sheet layout)
Adobe Creative Suite
GSuite
Nice to Have but not Mandatory
Experience designing residential projects
Construction experience
Fluent in Spanish or another second language
Sustainable design knowledge
Permitting process experience
Construction administration
Custom detail drawing experience
Compensation & Benefits
Above market salary
Full time but flexible work hours
An ownership culture, you will be respected as the leader of your work and a future leader in your field
Hours for licensure, mentorship, time and tests paid for.
11 federal holidays, and 3-4 weeks of vacation
Work from home or the office as desired (a policy for 5+ years now)
Healthcare stipend paid directly
Annual team-building events and trips. We're shooting for a legendary annual cat-skiing trip.
How To Apply
Submit your application by emailing a single PDF to us at team@newavenuehomes.com. Please include the following information:
Cover letter - 1 pg max (short and sweet will do it)
Resume
References - include previous employers, mentors, peers, and clients if possible
Portfolio - we will be looking for examples of built projects as well as any theoretical designs, student work, or work in progress.
Please format the above information into a single PDF no larger than 10mb. A link to a personal project, any writing or content you've created, website, blog, social media or other examples of who you are and what you did is a plus and is welcomed.
About New Avenue
New Avenue is a full-service design–build company, we manage residential projects from the initial call through a comprehensive design and construction process. The entire process is centered on the homeowner and our goal is to create a home that will be a source of health, happiness, and value throughout your lifetime and for generations to follow. We do this with a focus on quality, transparency, sustainability and improving the built environment through design excellence.
Our Core Values
Quality
Every New Avenue project is designed to be durable, low-maintenance, functional, and long-lasting. We believe every client deserves high-quality service that is tailored to their unique needs. Our team works together and pushes each other to deliver a quality final product and an exceptional experience. We are passionate about crafting quality homes that stand the test of time.

Transparency
We built our process to eliminate the frustrations of hidden fees, budget overruns, and schedule creep. Using the budgets of real, completed projects as examples, we help you set realistic cost expectations from the beginning. From there, we provide thorough estimates and well-defined project schedules so you know what to expect and can track progress along the way. Our proprietary app keeps communication, agreements, invoices, and payments all in one place and accessible from anywhere.

Sustainability
We design homes that address sustainability in three ways: environmental, social, and economic. Our buildings are calibrated for high performance, reducing the energy, water, and resources needed to make them function. Your project will be designed with strong connections to the surrounding landscape in order to have a positive impact on the environment. Interiors are laid out to maximize comfort, views, and natural light. Our practices add accessible, affordable housing, making more homes available to those who need them. Our designers make each homeowner's needs a priority and are skilled in techniques such as universal design. Economic sustainability comes from the return on investment adding units provides. We help you build wealth, diversify income streams, and bring economic sustainability to your life.

Design Excellence
Every successful project has to meet your goals and needs, be a highly functional and durable building, and also be beautiful and inspirational. It is our mission to design an inspiring space that is beautiful to look at, complements its environment, and makes you feel at home.

Job Summary and Mission
Starbucks is seeking a highly motivated accountant I to join the Corporate Accounting team. Our team leads the accounting for multiple areas of the organization, including compensation and benefits, corporate treasury activities, sustainability initiatives, the Starbucks Foundation, and others. This position will be responsible for accounting activities necessary to produce accurate and timley financial statements and related analysis specific to compensation and benefits, in order to support our internal and external financial reporting requirements.
Accordingly, we are seeking someone highly motivated, with an ability to flex to different areas of responsibility, with an eagerness to learn and build relationships. This position, with oversight, is integral to Starbucks success by ensuring the accurate and timely completion of moderately complex accounting functions, supporting key internal controls, maintaining one or a combination of accounting, budget or cost systems and preparing financial reports and analyses. Models and acts in accordance with Starbucks guiding principles and values.
Summary of Key Responsibilities
Responsibilities and essential job functions include but are not limited to the following:
Maintains accounting records. Prepares accurate journal entries and account reconciliations that are compliant with company policies and applicable accounting principles with supervision. Provides information for the production of financial statements.Assists in maintaining various systems and processes in area of responsibility. Supports implementation of process improvements as outlined by management. Provides feedback regarding implementation requirements.With guidance, prepares accurate and timely reports for assigned business unit(s) or department(s) to support company accounting, reporting and forecasting cycles.Researches and provides timely, accurate and complete responses to routine questions from customers.Highlights issues to management based on results of analysis.Participates in and provides support to cross-functional teams. Conducts analyses as needed to support project objectives. Participates in other projects and assignments as needed to support the goals of the department

Summary of Experience
Bachelor’s degree preferred; degree in Accounting, Finance or related field preferred.Experience or aptitude to work with business intelligence and reporting tools.CPA eligible preferred.
Required Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
Strong problem solving and analytical skills.Excellent written and verbal communication skills; effectively communicates to individuals at various levels of the organization in a clear and concise manner.Ability to collaborate with cross functional teams to complete assigned tasks and meet deadlines.Ability to multi-task and manage priorities effectively in a fast paced environment, while exhibiting exceptional attention to detail and continuously driving process improvements.Abiltity to work independently in a work from home environment.Basic skills in Microsoft Excel, Powerpoint, and Word.Displays initiative, has the ability to improve processes and document work performed.Ability to maintain confidentiatily when when working sensitive data.

job_title: Director, Supply Chain Sustainability Analyst - Remote North America
job_descriptions:
What makes Gartner Research & Advisory a GREAT fit for you? When you join the world’s leading Research & Advisory company, you’ll be part of a team that values curiosity, expert insights, bold ideas and intellectual courage, while driving partnerships with global organizations to make the right decisions on their key initiatives. Through constant learning, discovery and collaboration, you’ll not only help clients accomplish their mission-critical priorities, but also grow your career and the scope of your impact across industries. Our culture demands dedication— and rewards it with opportunity. If you’re always looking for what’s next in business and technology, Gartner is looking for you.
Interested in learning more, view and register for any of our upcoming recruiting events here!
Role: Director, Supply Chain Sustainability Analyst
Location: Remote North America
What makes Gartner Research a GREAT fit for you?
When you join Gartner Research, you’ll be part of a leading-edge team that values expert insights, bold ideas and intellectual courage. You’ll deliver must-have research through compelling client interactions and contribute to our double-digit growth by providing our clients worldwide the unbiased insight they need to make the right decisions on their key initiatives. Through constant learning, discovery and collaboration you’ll not only help clients deliver on the promise of improving supply chain, you’ll grow your career and the scope of your impact across industries. Our culture demands hard work — and rewards it with exceptional opportunity. If you’re always looking for what’s next in supply chain, Gartner is looking for you.
What you’ll do:
Work with a cross-industry community of the world’s most influential supply chain practitioners and leading Gartner analysts.
Have specific responsibility for collaborating, managing, and developing content relating to the coverage of supply chain sustainability/corporate social responsibility/circular economy and ESG best practices.
Combine actionable insights with compelling research to support global Chief Supply Chain Officers and their teams
Publish content based on fact-based impactful research that is used by our clients to enable learning and advance their mission critical priorities
Conduct ongoing interaction with clients and prospects (including meetings, conference calls, strategy sessions and formal presentations)
Prepare and deliver high-value presentations and other materials at Gartner, industry and professional association conferences, and client briefings
Drive client demand for your advice, content and presentations
Assist the Sales organization in selling and retention by demonstrating the value of research
Provide mentorship and support to team members
Lead or participate in research community meetings to discuss research issues and collaborate effectively with peers
Establish credibility as a thought leader representing Gartner’s research methodology and strategies
What you’ll need:
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform essential duties in a strategic, analytical, and collaborative manner. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.
Located in North America.
10+ years of experience in Supply Chain with expertise in sustainability/corporate social responsibility/circular economy principles.
Successful candidate is a passionate sustainability professional having directly participated or led sustainability initiatives at the enterprise level and or within supply chain functions or COE teams.
Deep understanding of the end-to-end supply chain, and ability to understand trends, best practices, strategies and critical success factors in the establishment and improvement of sustainable supply chains
Knowledgeable of global legislations, initiatives and associations shaping corporate sustainability initiatives
Ability to interact at all levels of an organization on supply chain and business issues.
Ability to represent and defend analysis in client interactions.
Excellent writing and presentation skills. Written work must be concise and persuasive.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills. The ability to influence “C” level clients.
Demonstrate excellent analytical skills; applying conceptual models, recognizing patterns and drawing and defending conclusions. Strong business acumen as well as analytical skills are required for this position.
The candidate must be a strategic and critical thinker, able to efficiently multitask, and to deliver high quality actionable advice on time through a variety of media. The candidate must demonstrate a self-motivated work ethic but also be collaborative within geographically diverse team environment.
Experience with the best practices and issues facing end users (“clients”).
Articulate and succinct communication skills; ability to explain complex ideas effectively and presenting to large groups in workshops and conferences desired.
Strong project planning and management skills with a strong team-working ethos.
Exceptional influencing and leadership skills.
Be able to travel 25-30% of the year including attending 2+ Gartner conferences per year.
Bachelor’s degree. MBA preferred.
Who you are:
Collaborative: experienced providing service and collaborating with global colleagues.
Organized: skilled at multitasking, prioritizing and working under tight deadlines and high volume.
Confident: able to make sound decisions on projects with minimum supervision. Effective communicator
Detail oriented: skilled at recognizing and troubleshooting errors.
Thought leader: strong visionary and analytical thinker
What we offer:
An upbeat, positive culture. Teamwork, integrity, objectivity, collaboration, and a no-limits mindset are central to our values.
Direct collaboration with smart global colleagues in a continuous learning environment.
Professional development and growth opportunities.
Competitive salary and comprehensive benefits starting on your first day.
Job Requisition ID:53727
By submitting your information and application, you confirm that you have read and agree to the country or regional recruitment notice linked below applicable to your place of residence.
Gartner Applicant Privacy Link: https://jobs.gartner.com/applicant-privacy-policy
For efficient navigation through the application, please only use the back button within the application, not the back arrow within your browser.

job_title: Transportation Analysts - Spatial and Economic Focus
job_descriptions:
About EBP: Across the nation and around the world, how transportation systems provide access and connections to jobs, commerce, and daily activities is a focal point of infrastructure planning and investment decisions. For more than two decades, EBP has been at the forefront of assessing the impact of transportation on people and businesses – thinking beyond traditional measures like the roadway performance to add a human element to our analyses.

We have experts across a global network of offices, including Brazil, Chile, China, Germany, and Switzerland. We work with our colleagues to prepare clients for the future, dealing with uncertainty, changing technology, climate risk, and strategic and technical challenges. Our leading-edge methods support better policymaker and stakeholder decisions about investing limited infrastructure dollars.

Committed to applying principals of sustainability, resiliency, and state-of-the-art economic analysis to infrastructure investment decisions, we seek to be the employer of choice for like-minded professionals. Our team is expanding to support strong growth as we serve new clients on these exciting topics. We are committed to building a diverse and welcoming team. We have a collaborative culture in which we come together to share ideas and develop methods and products of the highest possible quality.
Transportation Analysts - Spatial and Economic Focus

The Position
We seek analytic individuals who are passionate about transportation as well as spatial and economic analysis. We work on strategic planning, policy research, and economic analyses for a broad range of clients, including research programs, the federal government, NGOs, state DOTs, MPOs, transit agencies, and airport authorities. These analysts would contribute to project topics such as:
Interactions between infrastructure, land use, and economic development
Scenario planning, especially for long range multimodal, freight, rail, and resiliency plans
Access, equity, and research on specific subpopulations and users
Financial and economic models leveraging inter-industry relationships and characteristics
Performance management, metrics, and reporting, including accessibility measures

We seek people with the following qualifications:
Demonstrated experience in spatial analysis using ArcGIS, QGIS, and/or web tools
Experience in one or more of the following areas:
Programming/scripting and data visualization in R or Python
Statistical analysis, discrete choice models, econometric modelling, and forecasting
Analyzing survey datasets with accurate weights and linkages to supporting data
Travel demand forecasting and modeling and traffic simulation tools for various modes
Demonstrated ability to work independently and report progress virtually to a client/manager
Demonstrated ability to work and communicate effectively with clients and others in a team
Excellent English-language written and verbal communication skills, including demonstrated ability to communicate concisely and effectively in a work environment
Experience in planning and policy research and the ability to blend qualitative and quantitative analyses.
A degree related to transportation, urban/regional planning, geography, data science, economics, or policy analysis
Experience similar to a project-based consulting environment

These are early career positions for people who would like to grow with EBP.
What We Offer You
The opportunity to work on projects that seek to make transportation planning and investment more beneficial to society
Opportunities to learn our leading-edge methods for analyzing the economic benefits and costs of transportation projects, plans, and policies of all sizes and locations across the country
Opportunities to collaborate with other analysts, planners, and economists inside and outside EBP in a dynamic, fast-paced environment
Opportunities for career advancement and promotions
Competitive salary and benefits as well as flexible work hours and generous personal time off
Regular opportunities for professional development through internal trainings, mentorship, and professional associations

Work Culture and Location
Note that due to the COVID-19 pandemic, we currently assume this position will start in a remote/work at home setting. When allowed by public health and safety conditions and guidance, we expect this position to transition to working with our staff in our downtown Boston headquarters on a mutually agreed schedule.
Our culture is one in which we strive to support each other in work and life. Strong values, flexibility, and exceptional quality work are just a few of the characteristics we hold in high regard. We value and support a range of professional development opportunities, including mentorship, training, and engagement with professional associations and at conferences. We also take time to connect through shared activities like Lunch and Learns and Friday morning coffee hours. We are committed to practicing these values while staff continues to primarily work from home and to integrating this position into the firm remotely. We seek candidates with a proven ability to be productive and comfortable working in such an environment.
Teamwork and collaboration are important components of our ability to deliver high quality work to clients and candidates. Our office is a creative space filled with talented people, making it an ideal place to advance your career. We are located just a few minutes’ walk from three T subway lines, Boston’s South Station (commuter rail and Amtrak), and Boston’s vibrant downtown, Chinatown, Seaport, and Public Garden areas. Our building includes bike parking and health club facilities, offered at low rates to building tenants.
How to Apply
Please send a cover letter, resume, and two work examples to people@ebp-us.com. In your cover letter, please state: (1) your professional goals and interests, (2) your skills and qualifications, (3) your availability to work at our headquarters in downtown Boston when health and safety conditions allow, and (4) confirmation of U.S. citizenship or work authorization type and validity period.
Your work examples should include (1) a writing sample showing narrative presentation of analysis and (2) a technical document or presentation as well as supporting code and/or data files (e.g., .R or .PY files) that show your work.
EBP is an EOE/Veterans/Disabled/LGBTQ+ employer. For more information, email people@ebp-us.com.

Cascadia Consulting Group is a women-owned, private environmental consulting firm with 27 years of experience developing and implementing innovative solutions to today’s environmental challenges. Cascadia works with public and private-sector clients to advance sustainability through recycling and materials management, climate change mitigation and adaptation, energy efficiency, pollution prevention, transportation demand management, and water and natural resources management. The Cascadia team brings both established expertise and creative thinking to research and analysis, strategic planning, program design and implementation, outreach, social marketing and behavior change, and evaluation roles. From our offices in Oakland (CA), Seattle (WA), and Charleston (SC), we serve clients across the country.At Cascadia, we strive to create an equitable and inclusive environment at all levels of the organization. Having staff and partnerships that reflect the diverse communities we serve empowers us to shape innovative and effective solutions together with those most impacted by social, human, and environmental health challenges.Position Overview Cascadia is currently seeking a Climate and Sustainability Associate to support, lead, and expand our sustainability and climate change adaptation and mitigation projects in California. Specifically, the Associate will:Support and/or lead the development of climate and sustainability action plans for local government clients. These projects often include analysis of projected climate impacts, quantification of current and future greenhouse gas emissions, identification and prioritization of strategies to build resiliency and reduce emissions, and synthesis into a clear and actionable plan document.Support and/or lead equitable and inclusive public engagement around climate and sustainability issues (e.g., online and in-person workshops, pop-up events, briefings at community meetings, focus groups, social media).Support and/or lead facilitation (e.g., draft presentation slides, prepare meeting materials, guide discussions, and take notes) of stakeholder interviews, focus groups, meetings, and workshops.Research policies, trends, and best practices related to climate change mitigation and adaptation, energy, transportation, materials management, natural resource management, and other sustainability topics, with a focus on these issues within the California political, economic, and technological context.Effectively write and verbally communicate using a diversity of styles and perspectives including synthesizing and translating complex information into clear, informative, and compelling materials (e.g., summaries, fact sheets, presentations, online dashboards, reports).Communicate directly and build positive relationships with clients/partners and perform project and team management duties, including scoping, developing and monitoring budgets, planning, supporting partners, delegating tasks, managing subcontractors, reporting, and invoicing from initiation to completion.Engage in business development, including formulating products and services, meeting with prospective clients and partners, and all aspects of proactive marketing and bidding on proposals (teaming, strategy, proposal-writing, budgeting, interviewing).Synthesize and build policy recommendations from analytical outcomes, such as from greenhouse gas inventories and “wedge” analyses, climate vulnerability assessments, and sustainability metrics tracking and dashboards.Actively reflect and improve upon efforts to incorporate diversity, equity, and inclusion concepts into client work.Occasionally travel, when permissible, including for public engagement, meetings, overnight stays, or other activities outside standard work hours.Perform other duties as required.Required Qualifications Understanding of, and commitment to, Cascadia’s mission to “inspire and empower communities everywhere to protect and restore our world” in an equitable and inclusive way.A commitment to racial equity and the ability to apply racial equity principles to project work with clients, partners, and colleagues in an innovative and culturally responsible way while exhibiting emotional intelligence (i.e., culturally responsive engagement and facilitation).Demonstrated experience planning and implementing comprehensive public/stakeholder engagement strategies, including virtually.Working knowledge of climate science, climate adaptation and mitigation strategies, and ability to quickly learn about climate change issues.Demonstrated familiarity with strategic plans, climate action plans, or other similar environmental or sustainability planning documents and processes.Knowledge of federal and state climate policies, with a focus on California, including CEQA, SB-32, SB-1383, and SB-743.Comfort making presentations to clients and presenting information in a compelling, informative, and persuasive fashion.Effective written and verbal communication skills in English with the ability to adapt to a diversity of styles and perspectives, and the ability to communicate scientific and technical ideas clearly using simple, commonly accepted language.Demonstrated initiative and problem-solving skills; exceptional critical thinking capabilities.Strong interpersonal skills, including the ability to handle challenging situations with tact and sensitivity.Ability to manage multiple concurrent projects and deadlines.A bachelor’s, master’s, or other advanced degree in environmental sciences, environmental management, public policy, or related field.Intermediate to advanced experience with producing deliverables with Microsoft Office 365 programs including Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.Experience with virtual teleconference/engagement platforms including Zoom, Teams, and Webex.Desired Qualifications Experience designing and administering surveys, including using SurveyMonkey.Graphic design capabilities, including experience with Adobe InDesign or Illustrator.Written and verbal proficiency in Spanish, Cantonese, Mandarin, Vietnamese, Tagalog, or other language(s) commonly spoken in the San Francisco Bay Area.Compensation and Benefits This is a full-time, hourly, non-exempt position based in Oakland, CA, or from a remote location in California. Hourly rates are based on experience and competitive with jobs in the environmental sector; the anticipated hourly rate range for this position is $31.25 – $38.94/hour (equivalent to a salaried range of $65,000 – $81,000).The work may require flexible hours (including hours beyond the standard workday, such as weekends and evenings). Cascadia offers a flexible workplace with a generous benefit package, including health insurance for employees at or above 60% full-time equivalent, 401(k) with an employer match, life insurance, long-term disability insurance, transportation subsidies, flexible spending accounts, generous paid time off, professional development opportunities, sabbaticals, and paid parental leave.How to Apply Submit a compelling cover letter outlining your passion for, and fit with, the position. Please also provide a complete chronological resume. Send both to jobs@ cascadiaconsulting.com and indicate “Climate and Sustainability Associate - [Your Name]” in the subject line. Your cover letter should address your ability to meet the criteria in the Required Qualifications section and highlight relevant experience, education, and why you are interested in this position. Please state where you learned about the position. Applications will be accepted until the position is filled.Job Type: Full-timePay: $31.25 - $38.94 per hourBenefits:401(k)401(k) matchingDental insuranceFlexible scheduleFlexible spending accountHealth insuranceLife insuranceParental leaveVision insurancePhysical Setting:OfficeSchedule:Monday to FridayEducation:Bachelor's (Preferred)Work Location:One locationCompany's website:http://www.cascadiaconsulting.com/Work Remotely:Temporarily due to COVID-19COVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview processPersonal protective equipment provided or requiredSocial distancing guidelines in placeVirtual meetingsSanitizing, disinfecting, or cleaning procedures in place

Company Description
RockCreek is a leading global investment management firm that applies data-driven technology and innovation to sustainable investing. RockCreek’s entrepreneurial spirit, open culture, and inclusive team lead to better investments for universities, foundations, pension plans, and sovereign funds that partner with us. The firm is highly focused on the integration of environmental, social, and governance (ESG) factors as well as diversity and sustainable impact across portfolios to generate long-term returns. RockCreek has a culture of diversity, debate, and relentless drive to excel. RockCreek is among the largest inclusive firms in the world.
Since our founding, RockCreek’s commitment to sustainable investing, long term value creation, and good governance has begun at home. The way we operate our offices and partner with multiple stakeholders are in keeping with our aim to have a positive impact on markets globally and reduce our carbon footprint. Our founders have a deep commitment to sustainability as well as extensive experience with sustainable impact investing and ESG policies which date back to the 1980s including investing in energy, health, education, fintek, and financial inclusion.

Job Description
The Legal Operations Analyst will be joining our dynamic, energetic, and team-oriented group that operates as a central hub within RockCreek.
Using project management and technical knowledge, and technology, you will ensure the efficient execution of deliverables and prepare the needed plans, schedules and documentation and communicate to stakeholders within RockCreek and externally. You will play a key role in successfully implementing and executing investments from idea to execution for our global portfolios that hold a wide range of asset types including private equity, venture capital, impact investments and alternative investments.
Key Responsibilities include:
Using technology to improve efficiency and effectiveness.
Document preparation and review, extraction of data in multiple formats and document management
Creating and maintaining matrices for transaction tracking
The successful candidate will be a self-motivated individual with an interest in investment management documentation and organization that works well in a multi-task driven, fast-paced, deadline driven environment.

Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree and 1-3 years of legal/ documentation execution experience in an investment management legal environment. Or the equivalent combination of education and/or relevant experience. Recent JD a plus
Comfort with using many forms of technology; proficiency with Microsoft suite, including Teams, SharePoint; Excel; as well as AWS, project management tools such as Asana and Slack. Experience with Canva is a plus
Strong written and verbal communications skills; ability to respond quickly
Self-motivated; able to take initiative and manage time efficiently.
Agility to effectively operate under tight turnarounds with a focus on quality and consistent execution with attention to detail
Additional Information
Benefits
Consistent with our belief that team members are our most valuable asset, RockCreek offers a competitive benefits package.
Ability to work remotely with support technology
Medical, dental, and vision insurance; dependents eligible
401(k) retirement plan with company match
Paid time off, sick leave, and company holidays
Wellness programs including meditation and fitness classes
Onsite gym
Additional Information
For additional information on RockCreek, please visit https://therockcreekgroup.com
Follow us on LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/the-rock-creek-group/
RockCreek is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate against any employee or job applicant because of race, color, religion, national origin, sex, gender, gender identity, physical or mental disability, or age.

Job Description Summary
The Vice President, Sustainability and Environment, Health and Safety (EHS&S) is responsible for leading and driving all aspects of BD’s Sustainability programs and initiatives and BD’s global EHS&S function. They have accountability, along with the BD Executive Leadership Team, for performance against BD’s publicly stated sustainability goals.
Job Description
GENERAL FUNCTION:
The Vice President, Sustainability and Environment, Health and Safety (EHS&S) is responsible for leading and driving all aspects of BD’s Sustainability programs and initiatives and BD’s global EHS&S function. They have accountability, along with the BD Executive Leadership Team, for performance against BD’s publicly stated sustainability goals. The role’s portfolio includes associate safety, environmental affairs, product stewardship governance and compliance, EHS governance and compliance, human rights programs, sustainability metrics and analytics, energy/water/waste management, and ESG reporting and disclosures. This leader will partner and co-lead sustainability strategies embedded within key functions and business platforms. They will engage externally through multiple stakeholder channels to identify other emerging areas of responsible business and continuously prepare BD to meet and exceed stakeholder expectations. They will represent BD in external sustainability and EHS coalitions, industry associations and events.
A member of the Integrated Supply Chain Leadership Team and BD Leadership team, this position reports to the Executive Vice President, Integrated Supply Chain and will be based at BD’s worldwide headquarter offices in Franklin Lakes, NJ. This leader will partner with leaders across BD’s business teams, regional teams and central teams to drive multiple initiatives aligned to BD’s 2030 sustainability program, including the integration of sustainability into product portfolios, customer-facing strategies and transforming operations infrastructure and supply chains to increase resilience and meet sustainability goals.
This leader will manage the central EHS&S staff, comprised of sustainability, EHS and product stewardship professionals in a variety of specialties, including environmental management, EHS auditing, process safety, product stewards and sustainability subject matter experts. They will also be responsible for developing and cultivating EHS&S talent across the organization, comprised of over 300 professionals working at the site, region and business unit level.
ACCOUNTABILITY:
Overall execution of the Sustainability program and performance to 2030+ sustainability goals.
EHS governance and compliance, globally, including certified management systems, audit program, regulatory sensing, standards setting and injury/illness prevention.
Product Stewardship governance and compliance, globally, including oversight of individual business units meeting unique compliance requirements for their portfolios, under REACH, RoHS, Prop.65, etc.
Human Rights management and ensuring close coordination on compliance requirements with key functions including legal, HR, ethics/compliance and procurement.
Sensing new and emerging stakeholder requirements and actioning work, as appropriate, across the organization.
Talent management and development of EHS&S staff, globally.
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Provide oversight and of EHS and product stewardship compliance programs and be involved in critical decision making and escalation of issues to leadership, as appropriate.
Lead the next evolution of Sustainability and ESG at BD through enterprise-wide engagement in developing, executing and delivering on leading sustainability programs and initiatives.
Shape and deliver the sustainability and ESG narrative for BD and cultivate stakeholder relationships through ongoing engagement work.
Partner with key internal stakeholders, such as Public Affairs, Communications, Investor Relations, HR/ID&E and Legal to ensure sustainability and ESG disclosures and communications are reaching key stakeholders.
Build and maintain relationships with critical stakeholder groups including industry coalitions, environmental groups, and sustainability professionals for key customers and suppliers.
Structure & Reporting Arrangements:
This position will report directly to the EVP, Integrated Supply Chain.
POSITION REQUIREMENTS:
EDUCATION:
B.S. /B.A environmental science/engineering, safety/industrial hygiene or other related scientific discipline;
M.S. or MBA preferred
EXPERIENCE:
15+ years of experience working in corporate sustainability/responsibility and EHS management in a large global organization.
Extensive knowledge of EHS and product stewardship regulations, best practices and EHS management systems, including experience engaging with regulators.
Ability to lead large teams, develop talent and increase capabilities
Proven track record of influencing across an organization to stand up new programs and initiatives.
Business experience at the commercial unit or site level
Must be a solution-oriented team player who is capable of leading a team and working collaboratively across multiple businesses, regions and functions.
SPECIAL KNOWLEDGE & SKILLS:
Extensive knowledge of EHS and product stewardship regulations, globally
Extensive knowledge of sustainability and ESG disclosure frameworks, including: CDP, TCFD, SBTi, SASB, and GRI
Excellent business acumen, communication and presentation skills
Experience influencing externally, and working with policy/advocacy teams
Ability to influence internal work systems and processes
Willing to travel domestically and internationally, as required
Primary Work Location
USA NJ - Franklin Lakes
Additional Locations
Work Shift

Inorganics Specialist/Environmental ChemistPosition DescriptionWe are currently seeking an experienced chemist proficient with Thermo IC Systems, OI Analytical Instruments, ICP-MS, CVAAS, and CVAFS as well as performing maintenance and troubleshooting of this equipment. Additionally, the individual will be capable of adapting to numerous responsibilities, well-organized, and able to maintain meticulous and accurate records in a fast-paced environment. The selected individual will be self-motivated and self-directed, yet work as part of a team to provide our clients with high quality analytical testing of waters, soils/solids, and air samples.This position is at our laboratory located at the company headquarters in Holt, Michigan and is a salaried, exempt position.Job Requirements: · A.S. in Chemistry or Environmental Sciences, B.S. in Chemistry preferred· Preferred experience includes working in progressively challenging laboratory roles such as laboratory instrumentation operation and maintenance skills; data review; knowledge of EPA methods and QA/QC practices· 3-5 years of lab experience with common inorganic chemistry instrumentation and analyses (Ion Chromatography, Spectrophotometry, Trace Metals analyses, etc.)· Knowledge of safe laboratory practices, including the proper procedures in handling chemicals and unknown environmental samples· Ability to build and maintain open, productive communication and good working relationships· Excellent oral and written communication, and attention to detail· Strong computer, scientific, and organizational skills· Ability to multitask· Ability to work independently as well as part of a team· Self-motivation, adaptability, and a positive attitudeAdditional Information: · Ideal candidates will reside within a 40-minute commute time to our Holt Office.· Candidates must have authorization to work in the U.S. indefinitely without restriction or sponsorship. Only those applicants interviewed will be notified of the results.· Fibertec management reserves the right to close this posting prior to its original end date once a sufficient number of resumes have been received.About Our Company: Fibertec is a diversified, Michigan-based environmental service company that offers sampling and analytical services to its clients from three offices, employing a total of approximately 70 people. The Holt, Michigan office provides environmental laboratory services to assist clients in complying with discharge permits and assesses samples for the presence of contaminants in soil, water, and air taken from known and suspected contaminated properties. Additionally, our analyses help determine whether contaminants have spread to surrounding properties and provide data on the effectiveness of cleanup programs. Sustainability and Innovation Partnerships Leader
Chicago
Illinois (US)
8535BR
Job Description and Requirements
TC Transcontinental, Making Impressions Count

TC Transcontinental is a leader in flexible packaging in North America, and Canada’s largest printer. The Corporation is also the leading Canadian French-language educational publishing group. For over 40 years, TC Transcontinental’s story has been one of innovation and transformation to meet our customers’ evolving needs. Our strong family values, entrepreneurial spirit and long-term vision have always been at the heart of our success. With our three business segments in Packaging, Print and Media, we continue to optimize, transform and grow while making impressions that count!

TC Transcontinental Packaging brings a distinctive blend of science, technology, and art together to create flexible packaging that preserves our customers' products and accentuates their brands on the store shelf. The Packaging sector has over 4,000 employees and 29 production facilities worldwide. We specialize in extrusion, lamination, flexographic printing and converting of plastic products. You will join a high-performing team that is passionate about creating the perfect package, no matter what industry.

About this opportunity


You will have an opportunity to drive innovations in sustainability and be on the forefront of TC Transcontinental Packaging’s growth agenda. Join a dynamic and impactful R&D team. Help us transform TC into the undisputed innovation leader in sustainable flexible packaging. This position will work from home office within continental US.

What you will do

Develop relationships and lead discussions with industry sustainability related organizations, NGOs, retailers, and CPGs to stay abreast of and influence their legislative, regulatory, and technical agendas
Build a deep understanding of the flexible plastics supply chain and end-of-life scenarios, drive and support our goal to create a circular economy for TC Transcontinental’s packaging
Further develop and manage a technology scouting process focused on identifying, vetting, and industrializing emerging technologies relevant to driving our innovation and sustainability strategies
Interface with universities, government labs, or start-up companies to identify new materials, new technologies and/or new processes to meet customer and market needs
Justify investment in new technologies or start-up companies
Staying current with our customer and market unmet needs, and in close collaboration with our product development and procurement teams, regularly host innovation sessions with supply partners to drive unique value propositions and increase speed-to-market

What you have to offer
BS in Engineering, Materials Science, Chemistry, Packaging Science, or other related technical discipline
Expertise in packaging requirements and design; preferably 10 years+ experience in packaging manufacturing processes, specifically blown and cast film production, extrusion and adhesive lamination, printing, and bag/pouch converting.
Project management experience
Open innovation experience preferred
Proven strong interpersonal, written and oral communication skills
Willingness to travel regularly, as needed
Prefer that individual live within driving distance to one of TC Packaging’s locations

What we have to offer

Opportunity to be part of a dynamic and highly motivating work environment where you can develop your potential and launch an exciting career
Development opportunities where your input makes a difference
A competitive compensation package, 401K plan and flexible benefits that are customizable to you/your family’s needs
Employee perks and discounts from suppliers on various products and services such as insurance, wireless bundles, travel, and much more

Learn more about us

Job Description:
Job Title

Production Operator
Collaborate with Innovative 3Mers Around the World
Choosing where to start and grow your career has a major impact on your professional and personal life, so it’s equally important you know that the company that you choose to work at, and its leaders, will support and guide you. With a diversity of people, global locations, technologies and products, 3M is a place where you can collaborate with 93,000 other curious, creative 3Mers.
“One of the best parts of my job is feeling the impact of 93,000 3Mers collaborating around the world and seeing the difference they’re able to make in people’s lives.” – Julie Bushman, executive vice president of International Operations at 3M.
The Impact You’ll Make in this Role

As a Production Operator, you will have the opportunity to tap into your curiosity and collaborate with some of the most innovative and diverse people around the world. Here, you will make an impact by:
Leading innovation and sustainability.
Implementing change and continuous improvement to drive growth and increase efficiency.
Determining to do your best and challenge others to live and work differently.
Creating a positive, inclusive work environment that fosters learning and development for all.
Supporting production by monitoring processes, ordering inputs, loading semi-finished materials, inspecting materials, and performing quality inspections to release product.
Your Skills and Expertise

To set you up for success in this role from day one, 3M is looking for candidates who must have the following qualifications:
Possess a High School Diploma/GED or higher (completed and verified prior to start)
Must be able to work overtime, weekends, and holidays as scheduled which includes working 8 to 12 consecutive hours per day on a weekly rotating shift (i.e. Week 1: 4pm-midnight, Week 2: 8am-4pm) or a fixed midnight shift (i.e. midnight-8am), or a fixed 4 Crew shift (i.e. 8am-8pm or 8pm-8am).
Must take and pass 3M elected testing as part of the selection process.
Must be able to use and operate computer to run process operations.
Additional information that could help you succeed even further in this role include:
Demonstrate safe work behaviors to avoid injury to self and others.
Must wear required Personal Protective Equipment (i.e. eye protection, hearing protection, foot protection).
Tobacco-free/smoke-free: No smoking, electronic cigarettes or chewing tobacco allowed on 3M property including parking lot and outdoor areas.
Closed Campus: Because employee’s scheduled work shift including break time is paid time, 3M Aberdeen is a closed campus for production employees (no leaving the campus during scheduled work shift).
Must be legally authorized to work in country of employment without sponsorship for employment visa status (e.g., H1B status).
Supporting Your Well-being
3M offers many programs to help you live your best life – both physically and financially. To ensure competitive pay and benefits, 3M regularly benchmarks with other companies that are comparable in size and scope.
Resources for You
For more details on what happens before, during and after the interview process, check out the Insights for Candidates page at 3M.com/careers.
All communications and/or updates regarding a submitted application will be made using the email that has been provided on this application. Please check email on a regular basis.
Learn more about 3M’s creative solutions to the world’s problems at www.3M.com or on Twitter @3M.
Responsibilities of this position include that corporate policies, procedures and security standards are complied with while performing assigned duties.
3M is an equal opportunity employer. 3M will not discriminate against any applicant for employment on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, or veteran status.
Please note: your application may not be considered if you do not provide your education and work history, either by: 1) uploading a resume, or 2) entering the information into the application fields directly.
3M Global Terms of Use and Privacy Statement

Carefully read these Terms of Use before using this website. Your access to and use of this website and application for a job at 3M are conditioned on your acceptance and compliance with these terms.

Who we are:
LANXESS is a leading specialty chemicals company with sales of EUR 6.8 billion in 2019 and about 14,300 employees in 33 countries. The company is currently represented at 60+ production sites worldwide. The core business of LANXESS is the development, manufacturing and marketing of chemical intermediates, additives, specialty chemicals and plastics.
LANXESS is listed in the leading sustainability indices Dow Jones Sustainability Index (DJSI World) and FTSE4Good.
In the United States, LANXESS employs more than 2,000 people at 21 locations in 10 states.

What we can offer you:

LANXESS is a young company with strong roots! We derive our strength from global presence, management excellence and most importantly our people! Our employees are the pillars of our success.

We offer exciting career opportunities regionally as well as internationally, educational assistance programs, competitive pay and benefits, language training programs, and many other personal and professional development programs that are a part of our vision and values that drive our ongoing success.
Job Highlights
Safe and efficient operations of the PHT4 unit by supporting and participating in all related projects
Ensure all Safety and Environmental policies are followed
Follow good housekeeping practices to ensure area meets expectations
Ensure all standard operating procedures are followed
Ability to cross train on all operations within the area
Monitor the process in the field and/or in control room to report unusual and unsafe conditions
Identify routine maintenance requirements
Participate in activities and meetings which will enhance plant safety, reliability, cost and environmental performance as well as area production objectives
Demonstrate behavior consistent with site standards and coach others to do the same
Requirements
High School Diploma
Ability to perform multiple functions simultaneously
Must be a team player
Good problem-solving skills
Must be able to work a twelve-hour rotating day/night shift and overtime as needed
Previous experience in operations is a plus
May require membership in Fire Brigade
Mechanical aptitude (working with pipe wrenches and tools needed for plant activities and minor maintenance
Experience in operating a forklift or ability to learn
Participation in plant safety programs
Ability to work in a constant state of alertness and in a safe manner
Must have good communication skills
What we offer you:
Compensation: We offer competitive compensation packages, inclusive of a global bonus program and an individual performance bonus program.
Comprehensive Benefits: We provide a variety of benefits to support your financial security, health and wellbeing including retirement plans, health programs, life insurance and medical care.
Work-Life & Flexibility: We support you in maintaining a balance between working hours and personal life. With our global “Xwork” program, we offer flexible working arrangements in all countries in which we operate.
Training & Development: We are committed to your professional and personal development and encourage you in the ongoing pursuit of education, training and knowledge through both formal and informal learning .
Diversity: LANXESS is an Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, veteran status or disability.
Join the LANXESS team!
Must include a resume.

About Lime
Lime's mission is to realize a future for transportation that is shared, electric and carbon-free. As the world's leading provider of shared electric vehicles, Lime partners with cities to deploy electric bikes, scooters and mopeds to serve any trip under five miles. One of Time Magazine's 100 Most Influential Companies in 2021, Lime has powered more than 200 million rides in more than 150 cities across five continents, spurring a new generation of clean alternatives to car ownership. Learn more at li.me
The Lime Legal Team is currently searching for a Litigation Counsel with expertise in general litigation, and experience in employment and personal injury defense.
We are seeking candidates located in Los Angeles, but the position will be remote.
What You'll Do
Management of outside counsel on personal injury defense with a primary focus on the US; collaboration with counsel outside of the US as needed
Work independently on analyzing claims in stages of pre-litigation, and litigation to effectively assess liability and damage exposure
Effectively negotiate settlements including all aspects of liability and damages
Recommend effective litigation strategies, including settlement, litigation, and reserve strategies
Set annual defense budgets and exposure reserves
Attend hearings and manage arbitrations and trials as needed
Review and revise motions drafted by outside counsel with some drafting required in house as needed
Participate in deposition preparation of lay and expert witnesses
Lead the collection of information internally and cross-functionally to respond to discovery
Conduct legal research, as needed
Manage support staff as needed
Provide advice and counsel to business on issues related to liability and damage assessment on personal injury
About You
Minimum 5 years of solid experience in litigating general liability claims; strong preference for candidates with experience in product liability and dangerous condition claims against public entities; candidates without the requisite experience will not be considered
Significant experience managing cases through pleadings, motion practice, discovery, dispute resolution, arbitration or trial
Solid case evaluation abilities, critical thinking skills
Mediation, discovery, motion practice experience required
Strong academic credentials
Bar admission in California
Experience with e-discovery practices
Excellent business judgment, communication, and interpersonal skills
What We Offer
Opportunity to revolutionize transportation in your hometown with the leader in urban mobility solutions
A position that offers a variety of career and resume building experiences at the intersection of product and operations
Work with a team of fun and motivated individuals
Competitive salary and benefits
Play a role in the transformation of urban mobility and sustainability
Lime is an Equal Opportunity Employer, but that’s only the start. We want people with different backgrounds, abilities, identities, and mindsets to join us—not just to do great work, but to build a better, more representative world.

ERM is looking for a motivated Project Accountant I in Irvine, CA.
REQUIREMENTS:
Bachelors in Accounting from an accredited university preferred
1-3 years of project accounting experience; professional services experience preferred
Strong analytical and communication skills that enable complex problems and solutions to be effectively articulated to all levels of the organization
Familiar with multiple reporting tools including Excel, ERP reports, Data Warehouse reporting and experience using mid- to high-level accounting software packages ( such as BST, Deltek, Oracle )
Ability to work with minimal direction in a highly collaborative manner to meet required deadlines and perform all necessary tasks
“Hands-on” professional with a strong attention to detail and organizational skills
Responsibilities & Tasks include (but are not limited to):
Be the day-to-day financial operational owner to assigned key clients, office, Project Manager accounts
Maintain relationship with Partners and Project Manager. Act as the single point of contact for their financial needs as well as assist in their success through financial support
Be proficient with the standard ERM Finance / Project Management systems / tools and share knowledge with other Client Financial Analysts as appropriate
Escalate finance issues as appropriate, and work with affected parties to identify, troubleshoot, and implement steps to improve processes and / or prevent issues from occurring in the future
Other relevant tasks are assigned by Client Financial Analyst III and or PCS Manager
Project Reporting and Reconciliation
Ensure all new project setups are accurate and properly calculated
Review Value Pricing Tool and project work breakdown structure (WBS) for reasonableness
Ensures all new projects are opened in GMS in a timely fashion
Ensures that current approved project contracts are accurately reflected in GMS
Reconciles fees and costs in GMS
Prepares final reconciliation and closures in GMS of completed projects in a timely fashion
Be the liaison for the Partners and Project Managers to create and maintain informative and correct financial reports necessary to manage the project / client finances
Be the central point of contact for clients to ensure financial compliance with Western Division policies
Collaborate with Project Managers to resolve any client financial issues; field and respond to questions and issues related to the project / client financials
Timely and accurate client project reporting and reconciliation
Be the liaison for clients to create and maintain contracts, MSA’s and or change orders for services
Project Maintenance
Preforms a weekly review of project time and costs posted to GMS with Project Manager to ensure accurate reporting of project activity. Follow-up and take the appropriate steps to correct invalid charges
Manage the transfer of incorrectly coded expenses and labor to the correct project
Partner with Accounts Payable to ensure the accurate coding of expenses
Revenue Recognition
Ensures that persuasive written evidence of client agreement exists prior to recognizing any revenue
Timely and accurate revenue recognition
Work with Project Manager to fix negative variances weekly; increase budget via change order; reallocate budget from revenue types (labor, sub, expense), transfer charges to correct project, write-off charges)
Ensuring Time and Costs are Collectible
Performs a monthly review of all open projects and investigates and resolves unusual items
Monitors status of open subcontract and expense costs to ensure that all vendor / employee expense obligations are recorded in a timely and accurate fashion
Client Invoicing
Monitors status of client Purchase Orders / Contract (where applicable) on an ongoing basis
Review project related financial reports to ensure accurate and timely invoicing to clients
Generates accurate and timely client invoicing in GMS for all billable charges in accordance with established billing calendars or contracts
Who We Are:
As the world’s leading sustainability consulting firm, ERM is uniquely positioned to contribute to the environment and society through the expertise and energy of our employees worldwide. Sustainability is what we do, and is at the heart of both our service offerings and how we operate our business. ERM and our partners are driven by a dynamic vision: By 2021 we will be the clear leader in our chosen markets, we will double in value and we will deliver on our promises to our clients, our people and our investors. For our people, our vision means attracting, inspiring, developing and rewarding our people to work with the best clients and on the biggest challenges, thus creating valuable careers. We achieve our vision in a sustainable manner by maintaining and living our ERM values that include Accountability, Caring for our People, Client Focus, Collaboration, Empowerment, and Transparency.
Please submit your resume and brief cover letter. Based on review of these responses, shortlisted candidates will be invited for interviews.

We have immediate openings for a talented individual who enjoys problem-solving and can provide a high-end customer service experience through our nationwide operations. Transportation experience is not mandatory but the desire to be successful is! Will be responsible for carrying out dispatching, customer support, and field work tasks including:
Field all on-demand intercampus shuttle requests submitted via email, text, phone or recurring request and assign the appropriate shuttle resources using Apple-provided automated software, or using GPS data to manually create effective routes and assignments.
Communicate with shuttle and coach drivers to enforce adherence with pre-designated CAP policies and procedures.
Communicate with commuter coach and shuttle drivers and vendor dispatchers regarding service delays, accidents, substitutions, GPS system assignments, and other related issues to assist in designing solutions to ensure continuous route coverage.

Analyze available vehicle resources and make suggestions regarding most efficient assignments, staging locations, or scheduling improvements.
Correspond and assign shuttles to handle group or event trip requests
Document coach and shuttle vendor performance for enforcement by CAP staff
Manage availability of shuttles within pre-determined shifts.
Bring an inventive, positive, problem-solving mindset to all dispatching tasks. Be willing to take chances and to challenge others to do their best.
Staffing on-campus stops at Apple in Santa Clara Valley to monitor and log operations, collect data, facilitate rider transfers, and provide general customer service to riders.
Periodically staffing commuter stops in the Bay Area for promotions, stop location changes, schedule updates, and to collect rider feedback.
Provide administrative support for commute alternative programs including

Friendly, patient, professional, personable and have a courteous demeanor at all times
Extremely detail-oriented, with exceptional multi-tasking skills
Proven computer skills including experience with Microsoft Office suite
Ability to listen effectively and understand clients’ needs in order to provide creative solutions

job_descriptions:
Sustainability at the University of Virginia is interdisciplinary, multi-faceted and highly collaborative, encompassing academics, research, and operations and a range of topics, including greenhouse gases, energy, water, waste, food, equity, and civic engagement. The Office for Sustainability is seeking a Communications Generalist.


The Sustainability Communications Generalist is a core member of the University of Virginia's Office for Sustainability team and will provide leadership in communicating University-wide sustainability progress, programs, and projects and engaging the community in sustainability through multiple modes of communication. The Communications Generalist reports to the Sustainability Director and partners within the Office for Sustainability and with others across UVA on overall sustainability communications strategies, maintains and develops the UVA sustainability website, and designs a range of engaging and timely content and engagement tools (such as posters, presentations, articles, newsletters, green tips, signage, social media posts, and case studies) - all tailored to a wide range of audiences. The incumbent also designs quarterly and annual sustainability reports to communicate progress towards achievement of the goals and actions outlined in UVA's Sustainability Plan.
Responsibilities include:
Partner with Committee on Sustainability, UVA communications departments, and others on overall sustainability communications strategies and consistent messaging/branding across a wide range of audiences, topic areas, and purposes
Maintain and develop the UVA Sustainability website , including development of new content and maintaining up to date information (i.e. event calendars, blogs) using Drupal
Create and edit engaging and timely content (written, graphic, multi-media; i.e. articles, photographs, videos, tools, case studies, news releases, brochures, blog posts, infographics, social media posts, etc.) on University-wide sustainability initiatives, including operations, academics, and research
Stay apprised of UVA & area sustainability stories and compile bi-weekly sustainability newsletters using Mailchimp
Draft and edit documents (written, graphic, multi-media) to communicate overall progress towards sustainability goals in a timely and accurate manner (i.e. quarterly and annual reports
Create clear, engaging, and motivating presentations
Create and update branding frameworks for various sustainability programs, events, and initiatives
Support the Office for Sustainability team in drafting and editing materials (i.e. signage posters, event posters)
Participate in the sustainability committees or working groups as requested.
Qualifications
Successful candidates will have demonstrated experience in developing effective digital communication strategies across a broad range of communication functions, strong writing skills, strong graphic design skills, demonstrated ability to create and manage websites, and knowledge of sustainability issues.
Demonstrated experience in developing effective digital communication strategy and a broad range of communication functions, (i.e. websites, social media, newsletters, infographics, articles, reports).
Demonstrated awareness, knowledge, and strong interest in sustainability and environmental issues; ability to translate the University's sustainability strategic aims and programs into persuasive communications materials.
A communications or digital marketing background with experience studying or working on sustainability issues is strongly preferred.
Strong graphic design skills and demonstrated experience conveying information graphically.
Strong writing skills and demonstrated experience writing for publication.
Demonstrated ability to create and update websites – especially using the platform Drupal.
Computer Applications: Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite, Drupal, professional graphic design programs (i.e. Adobe Creative suite – InDesign, Illustrator), social media, Mailchimp
Demonstrated experience working in a professional setting managing several projects at once, working independently and as part of a team.
Eagerness to seek out new communications opportunities in addition to responding to the request-revision process with colleagues and other sustainability stakeholders.
Education & Experience
Bachelor’s degree in a related field
A minimum of three years of professional experience in the fields of digital marketing or communications.
Budgeted hiring range: $50,000-$52,000, with UVA benefits . This is a full-time, 40 hour per week exempt position. We support workplace flexibility when appropriate but 100% remote work is not possible.
To Apply
Please apply through Workday, and search for "Sustainability Communications Generalist.” Complete an application online and include all required documents – including a resume/CV and cover letter . Internal applicants must apply through their UVA Workday profile. Preference will be given to applications received by May 17. 2021 The selected applicant will be required to complete a background check prior to their first day of employment per University policy. Please no email or phone call inquires. For questions about the application process please contact: Michele Jarman, Recruiter at emj2us@virginia.edu.
PHYSICAL DEMANDS


This is primarily a sedentary job involving extensive use of desktop computers. The job does occasionally require traveling some distance to attend meetings, and programs.
The University of Virginia, i ncluding the UVA Health System which represents the UVA Medical Center, Schools of Medicine and Nursing, UVA Physician’s Group and the Claude Moore Health Sciences Library, are fundamentally committed to the diversity of our faculty and staff. We believe diversity is excellence expressing itself through every person's perspectives and lived experiences. We are equal opportunity and affirmative action employers. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, color, disability, gender identity or expression, marital status, national or ethnic origin, political affiliation, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, veteran status, and family medical or genetic information.

Portfolio Business: CP Kelco
CP Kelco is a leading producer of specialty ingredients which are added to improve texture, consistency, and stability in food, pharmaceutical and industrial products. Our products are derived from renewable raw materials found in nature for use in jam, fruit and milk drinks, confectionery products as well as industrial applications. We work across the whole value chain from natural raw materials to customers’ end products. CP Kelco is part of the JM Huber Corporation, one of the largest privately held, family owned companies in the United States. With approximately $2.3 billion in sales and 4,000 employees worldwide, we have a combined material presence in more than 20 countries.
Position Summary
At CP Kelco, we are making the difference by providing efficient ingredients that are derived from renewable raw materials found in nature. Our nature-based texturizing ingredients can be found in numerous products that are used by millions daily. Our thought leadership is clear, agile and growth minded focused on creating value for our customers, creating quality products, and solving our customer’s problems with innovative solutions.
We are looking for an experienced Food or Dairy Scientist or Engineer within the Commercial department to join our team in the EMEA Sales Technical Services (STS) labs, who will be key in solving global customer driven projects involving CP Kelco product portfolio of hydrocolloids and texturizers. The role is a hands-on lab-based position mainly focusing on protein containing applications, dairy or plant-based, low pH like yogurts and yogurt drinks both long and short-shelf life, but also other applications like fruit systems like jams, fruit prep, confectionery, as well as condiments, meat analogues and bakery - supporting the food trends of the market.
Responsibility include market-facing tasks to address customer needs, and or internal requests to develop prototypes to showcase CP Kelco offerings. Task will include involve industry-leading technical support. Technical presentations internally and externally at customers or exhibitions. Planning and execution of trials in lab or at customer facility to implement new solutions or for troubleshooting, formulation support, product performance investigation and development. Trial planning with a statistical approach, interpretation of data and a strong analytical data driven mind-set, with an inclination to understand food systems on a molecular level is critical. Projects also include evaluating, optimizing, and understanding the science and technology behind CP Kelco hydrocolloid solutions within the application and processes, to provide the desired functionalities in the finished product.
This role is based in our Lille Skensved site (Innovation center) which is close to Copenhagen, Denmark. The position implies travelling internationally for up to 15-20% (outside of a pandemic context).
Principal Duties & Responsibilities
Strong individual contributor, who will be key in solving short term, complex, customer driven projects (Technical Service Requests) especially within protein-based systemsDesign and conduct trials in lab to support customers in new development or improvement projects.Recognized as technical contributor within protein-based systems.Develop and apply knowledge to implement and/or improve tools, techniques, and work processes.Create, analyze, recommend new products, methods or product solutions for target application.Provide technical training on CP Kelco portfolio and target applications internally and externally.Follow market and industry trends and institutional practices of food hydrocolloids in protein systems
Specialized/Technical Knowledge or Required Skills
Education/Experience

PhD ideally in dairy/plant proteins/food science. 5-7 years of experience in the Food IndustryStrong ties to Universities and academia on proteins and food science.Patents and publications are a plusGood knowledge in Rheology.Experimental trial design experience.Project Management experience and solid track record.Strong protein knowledge – dairy or plant (not meat though necessarily)Structure function knowledge – understands how the structure of proteins and carbohydrates link to function
Professional Skills

Financial acumenExcellent communication (listening & speaking) and presentation skills, fluent in EnglishValue and Customer-focused, pays attention to detail, has a sense of urgency
Personal Skills

Pragmatic, independent, extroverted, and energetic contributor.Proactive, Result orientated and creative problem-solving skillsTeam player with outstanding interpersonal skillsOpen-minded: open to new ideas and suggestions (either from customers or internally) and takes input seriouslySelf-motivated and the initiative to drive projects from start to finishCustomer obsessed with a curious, optimistic, and positive mindsetCommitted to adhere to the Huber Principles and Core Values which can be found here: https://www.huber.com/about/the-huber-principles/
We Offer
CP Kelco is part of the JM Huber Corporation, one of the largest privately held, family owned companies in the U.S. With approximately $2.3 billion in sales, we have a combined material presence in more than 20 countries. CP Kelco is small enough for you to be recognized and make a difference every day, and large enough for your work to have global impact in multiple industries. A reputation for high-quality products is our badge of honor. We’re proud of excellent safety record, commitment to sustainability and service to the community. Of course, we offer great benefits too.
If you have any questions about the recruitment process, feel free to reach out to Paul Moinel, Global Talent Acquisition Specialist: +45 2710 5625
We look very much forward to receiving your application.

Excellent quantitative and analytical skills.
Excellent personal computer skills (Microsoft applications, spreadsheet/database skills, basic programming skills).

Ability to prioritize and multi-task, and work under strict deadlines.
Demonstrated interest and/or experience in climate- and sustainability-related areas.
Excellent written and oral communications skills.
Strong organizational skills and detail-orientation.

Knowledge of commercial food service product design and energy efficiency
Familiarity with the development/delivery of public-private voluntary partnership programs.
Ability to prioritize and multi-task in a fast-paced environment.

Indigo improves grower profitability, environmental sustainability, and consumer health through the use of natural microbiology and digital technologies. Working across the supply chain, Indigo is forwarding its mission of harnessing nature to help farmers sustainably feed the planet. Translating data assets into meaningful visualizations that support actionable business decisions
Building a spectrum of models to power go to market teams’ actions - e.g., predictive models to track customer’s propensity to enroll with Indigo products or their risk to leave our business. Modeling frameworks to describe driving factors behind such propensities.

Comfortable working with SQL and python
Experience creating visualizations with python
Ability to quickly learn visualization tools like Tableau and Looker
Attention to detail, and inclination to compose good written and visual communication
Ability to work in collaborative environment with cross-functional teams
