Job Description
PepsiCo offers the world's largest portfolio of billion-dollar food and beverage brands, including 22 different product lines that each generate more than $1 billion in annual retail sales. Our main businesses - Quaker, Tropicana, Gatorade, Frito-Lay, and Pepsi Cola – also make hundreds of other enjoyable foods and beverages that are respected household names throughout the world. With net revenues of approximately $65 billion, PepsiCo's employees are united by our unique commitment to sustainable growth; we believe that investing in a healthier future for our planet and its people also means a more successful future for PepsiCo. We call this commitment Performance with Purpose: PepsiCo's promise to deliver sustained value by providing a wide range of foods and beverages, from treats to healthy eats; finding innovative ways to minimize our impact on the environment and lower our costs through energy and water conservation as well as reduce our use of packaging material; providing a safe and inclusive workplace for our employees globally; and respecting, supporting and investing in the local communities in which we operate.


The PepsiCo Supply Chain Operations group provides a demanding, fast-paced environment in a competitive industry, where growth equals opportunity and fun accompanies the challenge. We are proud to say that PepsiCo has one of the most advanced and sophisticated supply chain environments in all of North America. This role provides an opportunity to begin a career at PepsiCo with unlimited growth potential. The areas of focus for this position are designed to build future leaders within our organization and groom candidates for executive leadership roles.


The PepsiCo Fleet Engineering and Sustainability team is a high-performing team, responsible for building strategies that guide and influence asset design, sustainability improvements, productivity, and Capital leverage. The Fleet Engineering and Sustainability Director will lead this team in developing and deploying fleet assets that improve safety, reliability, and sustainability performance across the PepsiCo North American Fleet which is one of the largest private fleets in North America.


This individual will have exposure to Frito-Lay and PBNA’s senior Supply Chain leadership team. A successful candidate will bring an engineering or automotive background and analytical skillset to solving strategic issues for the fleet function.


The Fleet Engineering and Sustainability Director role requires blending strong technical capabilities with creative, external perspectives, and creating an opportunity to champion new initiatives that demonstrate breakthrough thinking. This individual will lead highly visible projects that will have a significant impact on the direction and performance of PepsiCo. They will be expected to work both independently on projects, as well as play a leadership role in the creation of strategies across multiple projects.

Support the design, operation, purchase, and deployment of fleet assets
Partner with key internal teams and external suppliers to optimize assets for PepsiCo’s
Leverage technical competencies to provide new insights on design and optimization
Deliver key business results and build systems to sustain the improvements
Lead cross-functional teams to develop value-adding systems and processes
Support creation and implementation of annual operational and strategic plans
Identify and define other business questions and issues and develop strategic, analytical, and financial frameworks to conduct analyses and solve critical business issues in collaboration with key stakeholders.
Demonstrate strong leadership and significant influence management skills with the ability to quickly gain credibility with a broad group of people – team members, cross-functional peers, and functional leadership.
Support the development and execution of the Strategic Planning processes for the function.
Clearly and concisely communicate the implications of analyses and the execution plan to divisional leaders in verbal and written form.
Build out Engineering and Sustainability team: recruit and hire high-performing team members
Coach and develop team members

Creative Problem Solving: Ability and passion for creative, out-of-the-box thinking to develop and vet solutions for the business, as well as a willingness to question the status quo and generally accepted beliefs.

We are seeking a Mid-Level Energy and Conservation Specialist to join our Global Enterprise Sustainability team located in Mesa, Arizona.
This position will report to the Global Utilities Services team up and through the newly created Global Enterprise Sustainability organization. Our mission is to provide reliable, low cost, carbon free energy, water and waste services to Boeing. We work with teams to procure and use energy and water responsibly to meet aggressive reduction targets.
In this position, you will be a key team member helping us to shape a new renewable energy future for Boeing. You will be responsible for calculating and reporting global carbon emissions. As a member of the GHG reduction team, you will provide insight and strategy to Boeings aggressive GHG reduction goals, enabling a low carbon future for Boeing.
Position Responsibilities:
Under general supervision, leads Boeing's Green-House-Gas reporting efforts
These efforts include the reports for CDP, CORSEA, local and state certifications, Energy Star (USEPA) and internal reporting
Collaborates as an active participant in setting and implementing Boeing's GHG reduction strategy
Supports the evaluation of products and technology relying on existing industry practices and documentation
Researches, gathers data to support the development of Company position. Under general guidance, researches and gathers data in support of contract negotiations, purchases, energy price forecasting, price risk management, portfolio development, transportation, storage, re-marketing and delivery of energy supplies to company operations
Attends meetings with outside organizations to gain knowledge and develop external contacts. Under general guidance collects data in support of budget forecasting process
Reviews invoices to ensure accuracy of charges. Under general guidance gathers data to support the preparation of plans, documents, and reports pertaining to company utility usage by collecting, analyzing, and interpreting data on utility consumption (e.g., electric, gas, water) and solid waste disposal in order to comply with governmental regulations (e.g., local, State, Federal) and company initiatives
Under general guidance, supports strategic planning by gathering data and assisting with the analysis
Under general guidance, supports data evaluation and performs limited monitoring
Support lean energy assessment teams during site energy/water treasure hunts; Infrequent travel will be required
Supports other team members in the utilities and sustainability organization to maintain critical business functions, during times of stress and outages
Employer will not sponsor applicants for employment visa status.
Basic Qualifications (Required Skills/Experience):
Bachelor's degree
5+ years of experience using all the following MS Office applications: Word, Excel and PowerPoint
3+ years of experience performing data analysis and/or reporting
Professional written and verbal communication skills to achieve deliverables
Preferred Qualifications (Desired Skills/Experience):
Certified Energy Manager certification
3+ years of experience reviewing and interpreting government regulations/requirements for energy related matters
Experience with carbon disclosure and/or EPA Energy star questionnaires
Typical Education & Experience:
Education/experience typically acquired through advanced education (e.g. Bachelor) and typically 6 or more years' related work experience or an equivalent combination of education and experience (e.g. Master + 4 years' related work experience, 10 years' related work experience, etc.).
Relocation:
This position offers relocation based on candidate eligibility.
Drug Free Workplace:
Boeing is a Drug Free Workplace where post offer applicants and employees are subject to testing for marijuana, cocaine, opioids, amphetamines, PCP, and alcohol when criteria is met as outlined in our policies.
Shift:
This position is for 1st shift.

Convent of the Sacred Heart is New York City's oldest independent school for girls. Job Brief

Our amazing front end team is looking for two new team members. Ideally, you come with open availability, a positive attitude and a desire to learn and grow.
Job Title: Cashier
Department: Front End
Job Region: California Coastal
Reports-To: Front-End Manager
Exemption Status (typically): Non-Exempt
Requirements: As a retail grocer, we operate 7 days/week and 365 days/year. Our in-store positions are likely to include evening and weekend shifts per the needs of the business.

About us: For more than 30 years, New Leaf Community Markets has been making important choices that nourish and sustain our Central Coast communities. We opened our doors as a small cooperative in 1985 on the Westside of Santa Cruz. Now, we’re a community-hub grocery store, that remains true to our progressive roots and good for the community ethos.

About the role: Operates cash register, processes and bags customer orders and performs carry-outs. Provides exceptional customer service and contributes to a positive and collaborative team environment.

General Requirements:

Engages the customer in a friendly manner, shares product information and assists in locating product throughout the store. Seeks opportunities to exceed customer expectations and enhance the customer experience.
Demonstrates ability to manage own time and models a flexible work style. Shifts tasks as priorities and circumstances change based on needs and conditions of department.
Represents company values. Works cooperatively and positively with fellow team members.
Gives and receives feedback in a constructive manner demonstrating company Speak Up culture.
Conserves company resources. Works in a manner consistent with company mission, vision and values and sustainability program.
Adheres to work and food safety policies set forth by the company and all local, state and federal regulatory agencies. Contributes to store cleanliness, maintains equipment. Informs store/department management of any problems.
Observes all company rules and policies. Understands and complies with specific department or location guidelines, tasks and responsibilities.

Position Responsibilities:

Rings up and bags groceries using company taught best practices and customer preference. Assist customers with carry-outs as needed.
Prepares Front End department for store opening and closing.
Accountable for following cash handling, register and return procedures.
Complies with alcohol sales regulations.
Processes returns per policy and requests assistance from lead or management for complex returns.
Uses Front End resource guide and store walks to learn PLUs and accurately process customer orders.
Keeps cash drawer organized throughout shift.
Assists with product go-backs. Re-stocks, rotates and faces products with attention to quality and expiration dates. Handles damaged and spoiled product according to company policy.
Responsible for assisting customers in bottle counts and overall upkeep and cleanliness of bottle count area.
Maintains cleanliness, organization and rotation of all areas, products and supplies. May assist in additional light cleaning / housekeeping tasks when needed.
Maintains awareness of current ads, promotions, holidays and events.
Demonstrates familiarity with products throughout store with willingness to continue learning.
Tools and Equipment Used (not all inclusive): This position may be required to use the following tools and equipment: box knife, baler, scanner, hand truck, POS, conveyer belt, industrial kitchen equipment (i.e. blast chiller, grill, knives/blades, oven, grills, scales, etc.), basic housekeeping / janitorial and standard office equipment.
This position works at a Medium level. Required frequently and up to continuously to be on feet with a mix of standing and walking throughout shift. Sitting seldom required. Up to occasionally, dependent on location, required to climb stairs, step stool and /or ladders.
Continuously required to: lift 1-10 pounds; push/pull 1-10 pounds; use arms, hands and wrists; grasping/squeezing
Frequently required to: lift 11-20 pounds; twist; reach below shoulder
Occasionally required to: carry 1-50 pounds; push/pull 11-20 pounds; bend/stoop; crouch/squat; reach at/above shoulder
Performs other tasks and duties as assigned.

This job description is not meant to be an all-inclusive list of duties, responsibilities and requirements, but constitutes a general definition of the position's scope and function within our company. New Seasons Market / New Leaf Community Markers reserves the right to amend and change duties, responsibilities, and requirements to meet changing industry or business needs as necessary.

What you Bring as a Candidate:
Previous customer service, food service, retail or grocery experience preferred.
Knowledge of retail Front End Department / Cashier experience highly preferred.

Physical and Environmental Work Space: Work occurs in a grocery store environment which includes surfaces that can be wet and slippery, moderate noise level, and temperature extremes in controlled environments in the cooler and freezer, and depending on location, working outside in all temperatures. There may be exposure to certain allergens and / or chemicals. In accordance with the Americans with Disabilities Act, the ADA Amendments Act of 2008, and other applicable state or local law, we will make reasonable accommodations to qualified applicants and employees with disabilities.

Board Mill Technical Assistant

28270 US Hwy 80 West
Demopolis, Alabama, 36732
United States

The Opportunity:
You will be responsible for tracking and increasing the productivity of the department, troubleshooting mechanical and electrical equipment, assisting the Engineering Department in the design, installation, and the startup of new equipment, covering weekend call for the Board Mill team, training as a relief shift foreman, and filling that role as needed, collecting and analyzing daily operational Key Performance Indicators, and supporting/executing trials for chemicals and equipment. You will report to the Board Mill Manager.

How you will impact WestRock:
1. Be engaged in safety improvements and support and interact with crews to address safety concerns as needed. Participate in crew safety meetings and reduce area exposure risks in the department.
2. Troubleshooting equipment and processes. Understand the equipment operation to aid in the identification of problems, repair, and optimization of the system.
3. Train as a shift foreman. Understand the contract, be able to lead a crew, be responsible for the crew’s performance, and fill the shift foreman’s position as needed.
4. Investigate alternative equipment and process design. Seek alternatives to improve the safety, environmental performance, reliability, production, and improve productivity of the processes.
5. Provide assistance in developing capital and expense budgets for the department.
6. Track, analyze, optimize, and report on Key Performance Indicators for the Board Machine and Market Pulp Dryer. You will do this on an hourly, daily, and monthly basis.
7. Be able to create PI reports, navigate and utilize PI for process analysis, and support supervisors to grow their use of the PI system. Will be proficient in Excel, Gannt charting, Power Point, and Word.
8. Support the area team with the use of CPRO (trial documentation) and MOC process documentation (process changes).

What you need to succeed:
Four-year Technical college degree with minimum of 3 to 5 years’ job experience (i.e., Engineering degree, Pulp & Paper Science degree or similar science degree)

Fundamental understanding of mill processes affecting Paper Mill operations.

Good oral and written communications skills, highly skilled in group communication as well as one to one communication.
Ability to determine effective and appropriate means of communication.

What we offer:
Corporate culture based on integrity, respect, accountability, and excellence

Comprehensive training with numerous learning and development opportunities

An attractive salary reflecting skills, competencies, and potential

A career with a global packaging company where Sustainability, Safety and Inclusion are business drivers and foundational elements of the daily work.

Company
The Wonderful Company LLC
The Role
How would you like to edit content for well-known brands, see your work actually get produced, AND make an impact in the world? How about a unique opportunity to have access to clients, business unit leads, and our owners, for a 360-degree immersion in our products and brands?

The Wonderful Company's in-house agency is looking for a mid-level content creator and editor to join our Integrated Production Department. This is a unique opportunity to have access to our clients, business unit leads, and even our owners, for a 360-degree immersion in our products and brands.
In this role, you will work closely with our Director of Content and our creative teams to edit and shoot live-action digital/social campaigns, internal communications, documentaries, and more. At Wonderful no job is too small or big. We work closely with our clients to craft campaigns across multiple disciplines, so you should be comfortable collaborating with others to deliver the creative vision of each project.

The Content Creator / Editor should have a narrative eye and desire for storytelling but also bring an organized perspective to the tasks at hand. They should be able to execute an editorial project from start to finish. We are looking for a self-starter with a positive attitude, someone who's comfortable adapting working styles based on the needs of each project.
A Day In the Life at Wonderful:

A wide variety of fun, inspiring, and good-for-you brands and projects
A collaborative and extremely streamlined "idea-first" environment in which to make culture-driving, brand-building work that gets talked about, without all the layers
The opportunity to apply your editing skills to a very wide range of highly conceptual video and activation projects for our brands, most of which have never been done before
The chance to do the same in support of our internal audiences and our extensive philanthropic efforts in health & wellness, education, community development, and the arts
Production experience with the very best photographers and directors in the world as well as with tomorrow's up-and-coming production and post-production stars
Robust internal capabilities, including motion graphics, editing, and directing talent as well as brand-new editorial and tabletop content studio spaces
Mentorship by senior editor and motion graphic professionals
Access to clients, business unit leads, and our owners, for a 360-degree immersion in our products and brands

Your Contribution to Wonderful:

5+ years of content editing experience and ability to work as an assistant editor
Agency experience preferred
Experience delivering final edits, and working with assets from colorists, sound mixers, and motion designers.
Demonstrated fluency with the following creative software:
Familiarity filming with DSLR cameras (or better) and the ability to travel to the central valley for shoots ranging from B-roll, social campaigns, and short-form documentaries.
Knowledge of timing, motivation, and continuity as well as a basic understanding of color grading and audio correction
Intrinsic drive to always deliver the highest quality content
The flexibility to work as part of a team one day, independently the next - you adapt to new ideas, processes, and business problems with ease and enthusiasm
An attention to detail and clear communication that doesn't waver even under the pressure of tight deadlines or multiple assignments
A professional attitude and an openness to feedback that commands the respect of supervisors, clients, and colleagues
The traits that instill trust, build confidence and make you a joy to work with: honesty, dependability, responsiveness, flexibility, foresight, coolness under pressure, and a sense of humor
Nice to haves:
After Effects experience, or if new to it, the willingness to learn to help create animated titles.
Location
Los Angeles, CA
Perks
Wonderful's Dedication to You:

Competitive benefits package including Medical (including 24/7 online access to a physician), Vision, Dental and 401k with match eligibility
Opportunities for development and internal mobility
Manager and leadership training, biweekly L&OD webinars, and eLearning offerings
Companywide problem solving and continuous improvement training
Wonderful Giving (com) - allowing you to donate company money to a cause of your choice
Company focus on wellness and health including virtual yoga and mindful meditation classes

Headquartered in Los Angeles, The Wonderful Company is a privately held $5 billion company dedicated to harvesting health around the world through its iconic consumer brands. The company's 10,000 employees worldwide are committed to bringing consumers everywhere the freshest, most wholesome pistachios, citrus and pomegranates; bottling the finest water and wines; and creating colorful bouquets that are sure to touch the heart. This commitment is reflected in the company's market share: Wonderful Pistachios® is America's No. 1 tree nut and America's fastest-growing snack; Wonderful® Halos® is the No. 1 mandarin orange in America; POM Wonderful® is the No. 1 100% pomegranate brand in America; FIJI® Water is America's No. 1 premium imported bottled water brand; JUSTIN® Wine has the No. 1 Cabernet Sauvignon in California; and Teleflora® is the world's leading floral delivery service.


The Wonderful Company's connection to consumers has health at its heart and giving back at its core. The company has a long-standing commitment to corporate social responsibility, including more than $1 billion invested in environmental sustainability; $65 million in charitable giving, education initiatives, and innovative health and wellness programs each year; and $143 million toward the construction of two charter school campuses in California's Central Valley.

To learn more about The Wonderful Company, its products and its core values, visit www.wonderful.com, or follow us on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram. To view the current Corporate Social Responsibility report, visit www.wonderful.com/csr.

job_title: Principal Consultant, Sustainability Strategy & Disclosure (Mid-Senior Level)
job_descriptions:
ERM is seeking a motivated and dynamic Principal Consultant, Sustainability Strategy & Disclosure to join North America’s growing sustainability advisory service area. In this client facing role, you will primarily focus on leading support staff to deliver high-quality client work and grow the business. Typical client engagements include materiality assessments, writing sustainability reports, responding to ESG (environmental, social and governance) ratings and rankings, and setting sustainability goals. See Case Studies for representative client engagements.
The ideal candidate will have broad experience and subject matter expertise in corporate sustainability/ESG strategy, reporting and disclosure, project management, and business development. She/he will have a proven record of helping clients design sustainability/ESG strategies, deliver sustainability/ESG reporting, and/or realize strategy implementation programs.

She/he will be able to work with and provide direction to a first-class delivery team. She/he will be a business builder, able to identify opportunities to help solve clients’ sustainability challenges.

ERM has enduring values, which are fundamental to our business conduct. We are passionate about our people, their safety, well-being and development.
ERM employees take accountability, are client focused, and collaborate with colleagues across geographies. If you share our values and are motivated by opportunities to shape sustainability strategy and disclosure to make a real

impact to our client’s businesses, ERM is the right place for you.
"The business of sustainability" reflects what we do to support our clients as they strive to attain their business goals. Sustainability and business are now inextricably linked and, as experts in sustainability, we play a role in helping companies achieve their objectives with an understanding of how this affects wider society and the environment. We intend to contribute even more to the global dialogue on sustainability and expect our work on sustainability challenges and opportunities to deliver growth in our business.
Position
Key duties will be to lead sustainability strategy and disclosure projects, lead business development activities in our Corporate Sustainability advisory service area (i.e., sustainability strategy and disclosure), and develop support staff to enable ERM to make a significant and measurable change in moving companies toward sustainable business models.
Primary Responsibilities
Managing Clients and Projects
Demonstrates expertise relating to our core service areas of sustainability strategy
and disclosure
Builds strong and trusted relationships with clients and/or business partners
Thinks strategically to influence decision-makers and outcomes
Distills complexity from detail to effectively coach colleagues to deliver high-quality outputs
Demonstrates strong analytical skills, excellent writing and presentation skills, and a mastery
of PowerPoint
Demonstrates strong project management skills and oversight through the project lifecycle,
including scoping, budget and delivery
Teamwork and Organization
Effectively collaborates internally to deliver our services to existing clients
Demonstrates strong people management skills, particularly the ability to support, coach, and
celebrate others to advance employee engagement and achieve results
Identifies, evaluates, cultivates, and manages partnerships and relationships with clients’ senior
leaders, external stakeholders, and key opinion leaders
Acts as advisor and supports projects in North America and beyond as needed
Business Development Activities
Makes a significant contribution to achieving sales target by supporting account management
teams and business unit
Shapes and leads new business development campaigns, proposals, and pitches
Brings to the position strong connections to the sustainability community, including companies
and corporate stakeholders
Represents ERM at relevant conferences and industry events to strengthen networks and
relationships with potential clients and partners
Enhances ERM’s capability to sell and deliver Corporate Sustainability services
The successful candidate will be accountable for meeting personal billability at a budgeted rate,
personal sales contribution targets, and other relevant targets.
Key Skills & Competencies
Preference will be given to applicants who have the following key skills and competencies:
Graduate Degree in relevant field
A minimum of 10 years of prior experience in an advisory position with responsibilities for client
delivery and/or business development
Track record in building strong and trusted relationships with clients and partners
Structured and effective communicator who can shape and deliver messages to executives
and facilitate effective client engagements
Experience with line management and/or contributing to the professional development of other
teammates
Due to COVID-19, all ERM employees are currently working from home. Offices will reopen
when it is safe to do so.
ERM is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based
upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status
as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally
protected characteristics
Who We Are:
As the world’s leading sustainability consulting firm, ERM is uniquely positioned to contribute to the environment and society through the expertise and energy of our employees worldwide. Sustainability is what we do, and is at the heart of both our service offerings and how we operate our business. ERM and our partners are driven by a dynamic vision: By 2021 we will be the clear leader in our chosen markets, we will double in value and we will deliver on our promises to our clients, our people and our investors. For our people, our vision means attracting, inspiring, developing and rewarding our people to work with the best clients and on the biggest challenges, thus creating valuable careers. We achieve our vision in a sustainable manner by maintaining and living our ERM values that include Accountability, Caring for our People, Client Focus, Collaboration, Empowerment, and Transparency.
Please submit your resume and brief cover letter. Based on review of these responses, shortlisted candidates will be invited for interviews.
ERM does not accept recruiting agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, ERM employees or any other company location. ERM is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.
ERM is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.
Thank you for your interest in ERM!

job_title: Portfolio and Investment Manager, Autodesk Sustainability & Foundation
job_descriptions:
Job Requisition ID #
21WD47860
Position Overview
The Autodesk Foundation invests in the people and organizations using design and engineering for positive social and environmental impact through financial and in-kind support. We are seeking a valued team player to help build and manage a portfolio of 30+ multisector organizations and ventures solving pressing social and environmental challenges, ultimately driving impact in the world. The Portfolio & Investment team is growing its pipeline and annual investments, while at the same time increasing the rigor with which they source, evaluate and manage the portfolio towards desired impact outcomes. Reporting to the Head of Portfolio and Investment, the Portfolio & Investment Manager will deploy strong analytical and relationship management skills to vet and support organizations in our portfolio and play a critical role in realizing the Foundation’s scale and impact goals.
Responsibilities
Sourcing, Due Diligence and Investment:
Source new opportunities for investment and field inquiries from interested applicants
Conduct research and due diligence on ventures, funders and partners based on investment priorities, criteria and process
Write and present formal grantmaking and investment recommendations to Investment Committee, roughly 1-2 deals per month
Conduct investment re-ups and grant renewals
Portfolio & Impact Management and Strategic Post-Investment Support:
With portfolio organizations, co-develop operational milestones, impact metrics and key deliverables for funding period
Manage for desired impact outcomes: be upfront about asking for results and holding the partner accountable; as needed, help drive the conversation forward and being proactive about setting agendas and deliverables to drive towards mutually desired outcomes
Serve as a thought partner to portfolio organizations, contributing ideas, framing questions, and helping our partners think through ambiguous issues
Work closely with other Autodesk Foundation team members to maximize value of post-investment support: share insights and perspective with team, make relevant connections, and guide prioritization of support activities
Strategy and Operations:
Support development and implementation of Portfolio & Investment strategy
Lead design and execution of Portfolio & Investment’s Diversity, Equity and Inclusion strategy
Support development and implementation of Impact Measurement practice
Update documentation to meet portfolio management goals and complement cross-Foundation efforts; key documentation includes applications, grant agreements, and milestone reporting
Research new financial instruments and craft deal documentation to support the Foundation’s growing impact investing practice
Collaborate with Marketing to optimize Foundation website in support of clear messaging and inclusive sourcing goals, and to amplify stories from the portfolio
As the Foundation grows, build and manage junior staff (ex: Analysts, Coordinators) to contribute their expertise and capacity throughout the investment and post-investment processes
Support new Foundation team members, interns, and consultants to understand portfolio and investment operations, criteria and strategy
Provide analysis and information on the Foundation portfolio related to performance, sector exposure, and impact
Help develop systems to strengthen portfolio management across Foundation, including structured communication channels, clear reporting processes, and improved workflows
Manage grants management platform (Fluxx), including leading platform customization and further development to support the Foundation’s scaling goals, onboarding Foundation team and portfolio organizations, and serving as the point of contact for technology service providers
Help oversee external investment managers and manage the timeliness and accuracy of capital investments and disbursements
Minimum Qualifications
Minimum of three years of experience in venture philanthropy, impact investing, program management, and/or early stage organizations
Familiarity with the design and engineering industry as well as the environmental and/or social sector
Deep analytical and problem-solving skills. Comfortable assessing markets, industries, financial models and business models
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Curious to learn and willing to be a thought partner with portfolio organizations, colleagues and external collaborators
Experience and interest in emerging markets, international development, and technology innovation
Excited to learn the inner workings of a corporate foundation and have a hand in shaping the future of the Autodesk Foundation.
BA/BS
At Autodesk, we're building a diverse workplace and an inclusive culture to give more people the chance to imagine, design, and make a better world. Autodesk is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic. We also consider for employment all qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable law.
Are you an existing contractor or consultant with Autodesk? Please search for open jobs and apply internally (not on this external site). If you have any questions or require support, contact Autodesk Careers .

ENVIRONMENTAL SUSTAINABILITY/TECHNICAL SPECIALIST ENTACT is a national provider of environmental and geotechnical construction services. We directly self-perform environmental remediation and geotechnical construction work, using in-house personnel and equipment resources. ENTACT’s roster is comprised of project managers, field engineers, technical and regulatory professionals, certified safety professionals, certified quality control managers, equipment operators, field mechanics, and technicians, with diverse capabilities and experience. Established in 1991, ENTACT has been consistently named to ENR’s “Top 200 Environmental Firms”, has been the recipient of numerous National Safety Council awards, and has successfully and safely completed over 3,000 projects. ENTACT has 12 regional offices located in Albany, Charleston, Chicago, Dallas, Denver, Houston, Jersey City, Philadelphia, Pittsburgh, Port Arthur, San Luis Obispo, and Tampa.We are seeking an Environmental Sustainability/Technical Specialist with experience in developing and executing environmental sustainability programs, developing corporate and project carbon footprints, analyzing project data, tracking metrics, and contributing to sustainability reports, and monitoring global sustainability trends and practices. This position will also support ENTACT’s environmental remediation project teams technically and regulatorily and will require extensive interaction with internal project teams and external partners.Environmental Sustainability - Tasks and ObjectivesAssist in developing environmental sustainability goals, policies, and program development.Research and review regulatory, technical, and project-specific sustainability proposals and plans, considering factors such as cost effectiveness, technical feasibility, and acceptanceCompile greenhouse gas and associated sustainability data to support tracking and perform calculations of key metrics (e.g., carbon footprints and reductions)Evaluate sustainability data and develop reports and presentations to communicate the effectiveness of sustainability initiatives/programsResearch and evaluate new carbon reduction/sustainability technologies for potential implementationTechnical Specialist – Tasks and ObjectivesProvide technical and regulatory support to project teams throughout environmental investigation and remediation projectsProvide technical and quality control to support field activitiesAssist in reviews of regulatory requirements and coordinate with local state, and federal agenciesProvide database management and complex environmental data analysisPrepare various remediation and remedial design workplans and reportsPrepare and submit permits, notifications, and other required documents for implementation of projectsAssist in proposal development regarding technical/regulatory aspects for various projectsInterface with a wide range of internal and external team members, including clients, project managers, engineers, contractors, local state, and federal agenciesDesired Skills and QualificationsBachelor’s degree in Engineering, Geology, Biology, Environmental Science, or Carbon ManagementA minimum of 10 years experience in the environmental industry, including areas of carbon management, regulation, permitting, waste management, and multimedia investigation/remediationProven experience developing environmental sustainability plans and programs and calculating corporate and project carbon footprints and reductionsFamiliarity with carbon footprint/sustainability software, mobile device Apps, etc.Understanding of the construction industry and construction sustainabilityExperience in coordinating multi-media site investigations and remedial projects and experience with CERCLA Superfund sites and RCRA facilitiesAdvanced technical writing in support of proposal/work plan development and reportingExpansive knowledge of Federal and State RegulationsExcellent written and communication skillsAdvanced database management and computer skillsStrong project management, multitasking, and decision-making skillsWe offer an excellent compensation package including a team sharing bonus, health plan, 401(k), and much more.Job Type: Full-timePay: $80,000.00 - $120,000.00 per yearBenefits:401(k)Dental insuranceHealth insuranceLife insurancePaid time offVision insuranceSchedule:Monday to FridayEducation:Bachelor's (Preferred)Work Location:Multiple job_title: Sustainable Ag/ Environmental Camp Counselor/ Educator
job_descriptions: Sustainable Ag/ Environmental Camp Counselor/ Educator 2021 Sustainable Ag/ Environmental Day Camp Counselor/ Educator at Hart-to-Hart Farm & Education CenterDescription: Hart-to-Hart Farm Day Camp is seeking qualified individuals to design & teach sustainable agriculture & environmental lessons utilizing our gardens, farm, fields, forest and ponds. Educators/counselors collaborate to inspire and engage campers’ ages 5 – 16 to build a lifelong, meaningful relationship with the natural world on an organic farm. Campers participate in farm chores, gardening, cooking as well as a wide range of environmental and agricultural activities. Highlight: each camper adopting special farm animal. Goal: have fun while making a difference in the lives of young people through inquiry-based learning.Site Description: Located on a 285-acre organic dairy. Site includes historic barn, out buildings for chickens, goats, sheep, horses, rabbits and a free stall barn which is home to 130 dairy cows. Scenic pastures, organic gardens and orchard, ponds, wetlands, forest, and farm provide an idea camp setting to explore.Responsibilities: Responsible for all aspects of camp life: classroom preparation, participating in morning circle; running animal, craft, and gardening activities; overseeing snack and lunch time. Day starts at 7:00 am and ends around 5:00 pm or when prep work finished for the next day. Some weekend prep work may be required.Plan and co-lead daily “hands-on”, inquiry-based programs. Topics include but not limited to animal care and feeding, gardening, sustainability, insects, birds, soil science, freshwater ecology, wetland ecology, forest ecology, art, cooking. Topics taught through exploration, games, art, songs and stories.One overnight outing with campers attending Farm Extravaganza and Farm Explorer. (covid dependent)Participate in staff trainings, staff meetings, community chores and miscellaneous maintenance duties to contribute to the ongoing improvement of the campRole model healthy living, positive energy, clear communication and good stewardship of the environment.Follow and enforce all camp policies, rules and regulationsProvide first aid to campers according to camp policyDeal with any behavioral needs and issues in a positive and supportive wayReset and clean camp space, bathrooms, and kitchen as a team at the end of each day and sessionSupervise JCIT who are assigned to your groupQualifications: Experience working with children ages 5 -16 years of age in an outdoor settingCreative, enthusiastic, team player, flexible, excellent communication skills, a good sense of humor, self-motivated and strong work ethic.A willingness to get dirty, hike, work with farm animals and dig in the gardenKnowledge in sustainable farming / gardening and/or environment education (strengths can be in one or the other – animal husbandry a bonus)Physically able to lift 50 poundsFirst Aid and CPR certification18 years of age, completed 1st year of college or alternative program / experienceDate: June 7th – August 22th (11 weeks, includes 2 wk mandatory staff training)Compensation: $290- $340 /wk. Includes room & board (additional compensation based on education and experience) - – Excellent internship opportunity. Salary adjusted for those not seeking room & board.Deadline: closes when filled with qualified candidateTo Apply:  Send cover letter, current resume and application for employment (found on web site https://hart2hartfarm.org/summer-camp-job-opportunity/ ) to Linda Hartkopf, Director, Hart-to-Hart Farm & Education Center, 16 Duck Pond Land, Albion, ME 04910 or emailDisclaimer Must complete successful criminal background check and drug screenAll the above duties and responsibilities are essential job functions subject to reasonable accommodationThis job description may not be all-inclusive, and employees are expected to preform all other duties as assigned and directed by their supervisor. Job description and duties may be modified when deemed appropriate by senior management.Job Type: Full-timePay: $290.00 - $340.00 per weekSchedule:10 hour shiftCOVID-19 considerations:We will follow state guidelines during our camp season and require counselors be vaccinated.Education:High school or equivalent (Preferred)Experience:Experience with Children: 1 year (Preferred)License/Certification:First Aid Certification (Preferred)CPR Certification (Preferred)Work Location:One locationWork Remotely:No

Plastipak follows industry leading protocols to address COVID-19, including regular disinfection, electrostatic cleaning and temperature sensing kiosks at most locations. Position Description:
The Sidel Maintenance Technician is responsible for troubleshooting and maintaining all plant equipment with an overall objective of increasing business objectives.
Responsibilities:
Maintains, troubleshoots and services all plant equipment.
Adheres to the plant preventive maintenance program as outlined in PICS and follows proper work order procedures.
Locates parts efficiently and effectively utilizing proper parts room checkout procedures.
Attends required training sessions to increase knowledge base.
Performs all assigned work in a safe manner, upholding Plastipak Environmental, Health and Safety Policy.
Performs rebuilds, product changeover on all plant equipment and verifies that processes are reliably operating to achieve plant measurables.
Involved in installation projects and/or modifications.
Responsible for maintaining ISO standards.
Responsible for reporting food safety issues to personnel with authority to initiate action.
Responsible for on-the-job training of other Associates.
Miscellaneous duties and projects as assigned
Qualifications:
Associate's degree or equivalent from two-year College or technical school; or six months to one year related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Ability to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals.
Ability to write routine reports and correspondence.
Ability to speak effectively before groups of customers or employees of organization.
Ability to work with mathematical concepts such as probability and statistical inference, and fundamentals of plane and solid geometry and trigonometry.
Ability to apply concepts such as fractions, percentages, ratios, and proportions to practical situations.
Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out instructions furnished in written, oral, or diagram form.
Ability to deal with problems involving several concrete variables in standardized situations.

INSIGHT PEST SOLUTIONSEqual Opportunity EmployerAll qualified applicants are encouraged to apply, regardless of race, color, religion, national origin or ancestry, sex, disability, or age.This position is traditionally stereotyped as a “male” job, but Insight strongly encourages both sexes to apply for the position.TECHNICIAN (Pest Control)OVERVIEW:We are a privately-owned pest control company that exhibits exceptional customer service, innovative training for technicians, cutting edge service technology and an environment that enables our people to develop themselves. As a fast-growing company there are new opportunities for growth and advancement around every corner. We seek out competent individuals that are the best and the brightest personalities to ensure that our customers and employees know how important they are.POSITION:TechnicianRoute TechnicianUniversal TechnicianStart TechnicianREPORTING:This position reports directly to the Service Manager of the branch.NO EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:Prior experience in Pest Control and sales experience is a plus but not required. We will provide comprehensive classroom and field training to ensure you feel capable and confident to excel in your position. Our Training Program is administered by the company. If you’ve got a strong work ethic and have excellent customer service skills, we will ensure you’re provided with every resource necessary to succeed.PURPOSE OF THE POSITION:This position is focused on the organization’s main goal for sustainability which is selling new service and re-selling the value of existing clientele. Through Inspections, Estimates, New Sales and Service itself these individuals influence customer attrition and new customer growth.DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES:Regular Interaction with Customers to troubleshoot problems and communicate the details of the serviceBe able to work outdoors for most of the dayBe able to lift at least 50lbsBe able to crawl/kneel and/or fit in tight spacesBe able to apply liquid treatments to the soilSome drilling, trenching and basic cleanup after a job would be requiredData Entry & Documentation into mobile devises for services performedFlexible to work Monday-Saturday during the summer seasonQUALIFICATIONS:High School Diploma or equivalentExcellent Communication SkillsAttention to DetailAbility to read and understand simple documents regarding safety, regulatory or protocol standardsBasic mathematical skillsA talent for solving practical problems and effective reasoningTake and Pass a series of exams as part of a New Hire TrainingClean Driving RecordPass a Background CheckPass a Drug ScreenRELATIONSHIPS:This position will be trained by through Insight’s online University Program, monitored by the Service Manager and Lead Technician, with ongoing support and supervision.This position is expected to ensure quality towards all customer relations in a courteous, respectful and friendly manner. This commitment is to guarantee continuous improvement of services, from us, to facilitate this endeavor.CERTIFICATIONS/LICENSING:All candidates must either have an existing license/certification or acquire one with the assistance of company training.BENEFITS:At Insight Pest Solutions, we are confident that our people are the reason behind our successes. We truly value our employees and consider them as part of our professional family. Our goal is to offer the very best healthcare possible to all employees and their loved ones. With this is in mind we have developed a comprehensive employee benefit package designed to protect employees and their families. Every year, employees are provided with a Benefits Digest outlining the detail plans, which include the following:Life InsuranceAccidental Death and DismembermentCritical IllnessDentalVision401KMajor MedicalDependent coverage is optional and available at group rates to each employee. As Insight does contribute to an employee’s major medical monthly premium, employees will pay a portion of their monthly premium. However, all dependents added to an employee’s plan are paid in solely by the employee.All employees working 30 hours or more per week are eligible for benefits. An employee’s benefits will begin the first of the month following 60-Days of employment. Insight offers two different plan options (Bronze Plan and a Gold Plan) through Aetna.Insight wants all employees to feel valued and appreciated. Which is why all employees enjoy having their Birthday off, with pay. Insight believes that employees should have opportunities to enjoy time away from work to help balance their lives. Insight recognizes that employees have diverse needs for time off from work. After working for Insight for a full year, employees are eligible to receive five (5) days of Paid Time Off (PTO). Insight Pest Solutions stays in compliance with states with Sick Time laws. Sick Time is a wage benefit mandated by certain states. Under state law, Sick Time is recognized under Insight’s Paid Time Off (PTO) policy.Employees who have worked for Insight for a full year will become eligible to receive holiday pay for the following observed holidays:New Year’s DayMemorial DayFourth of JulyLabor DayThanksgiving DayChristmas DayInsight will ensure all technicians receive an assigned company vehicle to perform their job duties. As technicians are issued a company vehicle to perform their required duties, they are required to provide their own transportation to and from work if they have not been authorized to take the company vehicle home. An employee will likely be given authorization to take a company vehicle home after 60-Days of employment.All vehicle maintenance (oil changes, burnt out light bulbs, etc.) are paid by the company. All company vehicles are assigned a gas card, linked to that specific company vehicle. All company vehicles will include toll passage as well, also paid for by the company. Insight provides all necessary tools and resources to ensure employees are able to perform the job duties assigned.PERFORMANCE REVIEW PERIOD:Seasonal Review – seasonal review period ends at the close of the summer.SUMMARY:We believe that “customer service” is not a department but everyone’s job. We provide an essential service to society that protects our homes, our health and our environment. When this service is performed to a standard of excellence and with a great attitude everyone wins.If you feel you are qualified for this position, please respond to this post with your resume.Any candidates that are considered for this position will be contacted by phone for a preliminary interview so please be sure to provide a good contact phone number.DISCLAIMER:This is not necessarily an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, skills, efforts, requirements or working conditions associated with the job. However, the above statements are intended to describethe general nature of the work being performed by employees. While this is intended to be an accurate reflection of the current job, management reserves the right to revise the job or to require that other or different tasks be performed as assigned.Job Type: Full-timePay: $45,000.00 - $55,000.00 per year

Job Description:
Job Title

Production Operator
Collaborate with Innovative 3Mers Around the World
Choosing where to start and grow your career has a major impact on your professional and personal life, so it’s equally important you know that the company that you choose to work at, and its leaders, will support and guide you. With a diversity of people, global locations, technologies and products, 3M is a place where you can collaborate with 93,000 other curious, creative 3Mers.
“One of the best parts of my job is feeling the impact of 93,000 3Mers collaborating around the world and seeing the difference they’re able to make in people’s lives.” – Julie Bushman, executive vice president of International Operations at 3M.
The Impact You’ll Make in this Role

As a Production Operator, you will have the opportunity to tap into your curiosity and collaborate with some of the most innovative and diverse people around the world. Here, you will make an impact by:
Leading innovation and sustainability.
Implementing change and continuous improvement to drive growth and increase efficiency.
Determining to do your best and challenge others to live and work differently.
Creating a positive, inclusive work environment that fosters learning and development for all.
Supporting production by monitoring processes, ordering inputs, loading semi-finished materials, inspecting materials, and performing quality inspections to release product.
Your Skills and Expertise

To set you up for success in this role from day one, 3M is looking for candidates who must have the following qualifications:
Possess a High School Diploma/GED or higher (completed and verified prior to start)
Must be able to work overtime, weekends, and holidays as scheduled which includes working 8 to 12 consecutive hours per day on a weekly rotating shift (i.e. Week 1: 4pm-midnight, Week 2: 8am-4pm) or a fixed midnight shift (i.e. midnight-8am), or a fixed 4 Crew shift (i.e. 8am-8pm or 8pm-8am).
Must take and pass 3M elected testing as part of the selection process.
Must be able to use and operate computer to run process operations.
Additional information that could help you succeed even further in this role include:
Demonstrate safe work behaviors to avoid injury to self and others.
Must wear required Personal Protective Equipment (i.e. eye protection, hearing protection, foot protection).
Tobacco-free/smoke-free: No smoking, electronic cigarettes or chewing tobacco allowed on 3M property including parking lot and outdoor areas.
Closed Campus: Because employee’s scheduled work shift including break time is paid time, 3M Aberdeen is a closed campus for production employees (no leaving the campus during scheduled work shift).
Must be legally authorized to work in country of employment without sponsorship for employment visa status (e.g., H1B status).
Supporting Your Well-being
3M offers many programs to help you live your best life – both physically and financially. To ensure competitive pay and benefits, 3M regularly benchmarks with other companies that are comparable in size and scope.
Resources for You
For more details on what happens before, during and after the interview process, check out the Insights for Candidates page at 3M.com/careers.
All communications and/or updates regarding a submitted application will be made using the email that has been provided on this application. Please check email on a regular basis.
Learn more about 3M’s creative solutions to the world’s problems at www.3M.com or on Twitter @3M.
Responsibilities of this position include that corporate policies, procedures and security standards are complied with while performing assigned duties.
3M is an equal opportunity employer. 3M will not discriminate against any applicant for employment on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, or veteran status.
Please note: your application may not be considered if you do not provide your education and work history, either by: 1) uploading a resume, or 2) entering the information into the application fields directly.
3M Global Terms of Use and Privacy Statement

Carefully read these Terms of Use before using this website. Your access to and use of this website and application for a job at 3M are conditioned on your acceptance and compliance with these terms.

Meridian Consulting, LLC is a sustainable design and energy engineering consulting firm seeking a sustainability consultant for new construction projects. The ideal candidate should have an architectural, engineering or environmental science degree, or equivalent work experience, and an understanding of the commercial building design and construction process. The candidate must be detail-oriented and have strong writing skills. The position is based out of our Silver Spring, MD office with some telecommuting potential. Candidates must be authorized to work in the US.Qualifications:Bachelor or Master’s degree in architecture, engineering, construction management, environmental science or equivalent work experience.Experience working on LEED, NGBS or Energy Star projects is preferredExperience in the building industryProject management experienceTechnical knowledge and experience with building sciencesAbility to read architectural, civil, mechanical, electrical and plumbing drawingsThe ability to work independentlyCommitment to delivering high quality workProficient with MS Excel and MS WordAdditional optional skills and qualifications:LEED AP, LEED Green Rater, HERS RaterJob Type: Full-timeLocation:Washington, DC (Required)Work authorization:United States (Required)Work Location:One locationBenefits:Health insurancePaid time offFlexible scheduleThis Job Is:A job for which all ages, including older job seekers, are encouraged to apply

Join boundless thinkers from all walks of life working together to feed the world. Take pride in working with powerful brands, including Purina Animal Nutrition, Nutra Blend, WinField United, Vermont Creamery, KozyShack, and more.
You'll join a global team committed to everything from the seeds that go into the ground, to the technology that improves crop yields and sustainability, to the nutrition that animals need, to marketing the final product.
Line Associate - 1st Shift
The Line Associate will assist the Machine Operator and Lead with the daily operating functions of the Filling Line. Most Filling Lines are staffed with more than one Line Associates who work in a team. In this team, you will need to communicate with each and work in close proximity. The Line Associate will be monitored by the Department Lead to ensure Quality, GMP, Safety, Production, Training and Housekeeping requirements. The Line Associate will conform to the required GMP and Safety procedures follow all verbal and or written instructions of the Lead, Quality Control and Management Team.
Hours: 5:00am to 1:30pm (1st shift)
Wage: $15.50 per hour
Land O’Lakes, Inc offers a competitive salary and bonus potential. The company also provides a comprehensive benefits package as well as other company sponsored benefits.
Sign-On Bonus: $1,000; $500 will be paid after 30 days of continuous employment and the remaining $500 after 6 months of continuous employment.
General Essential Functions:
Comply with personal protective clothing, hair covering and hearing protection policies
Ability to read and understand English
Kitchen Area Essential Functions:
Verify and report any open cup seals/foils problems during the process
Report all Non-Conforming discrepancies to Filler Lead, QC and Management
Report to Filling Line work station on time at start up, and after breaks and lunches
Assist team in transportation of production carts, baskets, materials and equipment
Report all safety and GMP violations
Report broken, damaged, dirty baskets, carts, foils, cups or any materials/equipment that does not conform to our standards
Insure conveyor is washed down frequently to prevent any excess product spillage onto clean product cups
Notify Filler Operator and Lead of any erratic machine functions
Assist Filling Machine Operator with O-ring checks, cleaning and lubricating of cylinders and plungers
Packing Area Essential Functions:
Collect and insert the filled sealed product cups into the appropriate baskets with the correct rotation and placement pattern
Verify and report any open cup seals/foils problems during the process
On lines with date coded cups be watchful for non-coded cups and legibility of printed information
Report all Non-Conforming discrepancies to Filler Lead, QC and Management
Report to Filling Line workstation on time at start up, and after breaks and lunches
Assist team in transportation of production carts, baskets, materials and equipment
Report all safety and GMP violations
Report broken, damaged, dirty baskets, carts, foils, cups or any materials/equipment that does not conform to our standards
Ensure conveyor is washed down frequently to prevent any excess product spillage onto clean product cups
Notify Filler Operator and Lead of any erratic machine functions
Assist Filling Machine Operator with O-ring checks, cleaning and lubricating of cylinders and plungers
Knowledge, Skills, Abilities and Traits:
Follow instructions and support Filling Operator maintaining Safety/GMP requirements
Decision-making: The work instructions are very specific, with little judgment required.
Supervisory Responsibilities: N/A
Equipment Used: Variety of food processing equipment, hand trucks, carts, baskets.
Education Requirement: High School diploma/GED not required.
Physical Demands
Will need to be able to work in a cold environment where temperatures can vary from 45° to 32° degrees.
Will need to be available to work overtime, weekends including Saturday and Sunday based on production needs.
Standing - Entire shift
Pushing/Pulling - Use of both hands to grip equipment - Frequently.
Lift Capacity: up to 25 lbs. - Lift over head in a safe manner - Occasionally
Noise typical of a production environment - Entire shift/Hearing Protection Required
Time Demands:
On occasion, business demands may require some employees to work overtime.
When overtime is required, employees are expected to work extra hours as required to meet business needs – this is a requirement of this position.
ESSENTIAL PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:
Working in a manufacturing or warehouse environment, you will be walking, standing and engaging in movement throughout the day, and occasionally to frequently be required to lift items weighing up to 50 lbs. Due to a large variety of job duties (both routine and non-routine), certain duties also may involve, a variety of physical activities including bending, lifting, stooping, turning, twisting, pushing, pulling, raising arms above shoulders and head, standing, working in enclosed areas, climbing stairs or ladders, and operating heavy machinery. The noise level in the work environment can vary but noise is usually low to moderate.
At times, you may be required to wear personal protective equipment such as safety glasses, safety gloves, hearing protection, a respirator or dust mask, protective footwear and protective clothing or uniforms. Work may be performed in cold and/or hot temperatures and the environment can be dusty. Physical requirements further include the ability to engage in productive and collaborative communication with co-workers and work may need to be performed during non-standard hours, including nights and weekends. At times, the ability to work overtime also may be required. The ability to perform these requirements is necessary to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. The company engages in an interactive process to review requests for reasonable accommodations that may be needed to allow qualified individuals with disabilities to perform all the essential functions of the position. Requests for reasonable accommodation should be directed to the hiring manager.
Nothing in this job description restricts the management’s right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time.
Applicants must successfully pass a pre-employment (post offer) background check.

Description:
Midlab is currently searching for a Quality Assurance Specialist. This position will be located in Athens, TN. (An easy commute from Knoxville or Chattanooga.)
Midlab began its journey in 1980 with a simple desire to produce the best cleaning formulations in the industry, while building strong partnerships with customers. 40 years later, we are one of the leading cleaning product manufacturers in the country, serving a global market and leading the way in product innovation and sustainability.
Working at Midlab is rewarding and challenges each of us to be better, both professionally and personally. We are proud of the culture we’ve created and we strive to capture it in our core values. Our values are more than just a poster on the wall... they are ingrained in all that we do, including our employee evaluations. Our culture is the biggest reason we continue to recruit and retain the best talent in the country.
Do you like to be challenged, innovate, and be in an environment where you love to come to work daily— all while feeling supported by a team that wants to see you grow professionally and personally? If so, Midlab could be the right place for you!
We look forward to getting to know you and taking your career to the next level with Midlab.
Our Core Values
Committed and Empowered Team
Open and Honest Relationships
Relentless Customer Focus
Embrace and Drive Change
Values Teamwork & Family Spirit
SUMMARY
Quality Assurance Specialist in a fast paced specialty chemical manufacturing facility. Responsible for all aspects of the Quality System and programs to ensure compliance to all regulations and key customer requirements.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES, include but are not limited to:
Development, Implementation, and Maintenance of Quality Programs for specialty chemical manufacturing.
Maintain necessary documentation and record retention for facility audits such as FDA, EPA, Kosher, ISO, Green Certifications, etc.
Investigate and prepare internal / external reports on quality complaints and investigations.
Work with R&D on the development of product specifications.
Routine audits of manufacturing to validate Quality program effectiveness.
Analyses of finished product to ensure materials are within specification prior to release.
Work with manufacturing to develop training programs for manufacturing employees based on key customer and regulatory requirements.
. Requirements:

Bachelor’s degree in a science related field such as Chemistry, Biology, etc.
Advanced problem solving skills and data analysis.
Working knowledge of FDA, ISO, EPA, Kosher requirements.
Excellent communication skills both written and oral.
Experience in Analytical testing such as wet chemistry techniques and instrumentation such as HPLC.
We offer a very competitive compensation and benefits package including health/dental/vision/life insurance and 401K. We offer paid vacation and sick leave after at predetermined intervals of tenure. ABOUT YOU

Are you passionate and ready to join an inclusive work environment, committed to excellence, to new ideas, and to delivering value? If the answer is, “Yes!” then we have an exciting career opportunity for you. Who are we? We are Montrose Environmental Group, Inc., the premier environmental services provider.

WHAT WE CAN OFFER TO YOU

Our Mission is: To help protect the air we breathe, the water we drink, and the soil that feeds us, and is supported by our Principles: We Value Our People, We Value Our Community, We Value Our Clients, We Value Our Shareholders. We care for the well-being of our people and offer:
Competitive compensation and benefit packages
Progressive vacation policies and company holidays to ensure work/life balance for our people
A financial assistance program to help support peers in need
A DAY IN THE LIFE
MAQS is looking for Environmental Field Technicians to join our dynamic emissions source testing team. Our Field Technicians get hands-on experience collecting data while spending most of their time outdoors rather than in a cubicle – real science, outdoors in a hard hat. Entry level team members will primarily focus on teamwork with Project Managers and other Field Technicians in all aspects of testing projects including: preparation, calibration and deployment of test equipment, stack (or “source”) testing/ sampling, continuous learning about test methods, industrial processes, and more.
To perform this job successfully, individuals must be able to perform each duty and responsibility satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the duties and responsibilities.
Aptitude and interest in science, technical work, mechanical equipment, and air quality.
Capacity for overnight and local travel for multi-weekday projects up to sixty percent of the time or more. Limited weekend travel or work may be required for a few projects during the year.
Ability to work in outdoor industrial settings, including climbing to and working on elevated platforms.
Capability to pass background checks and initial and random drug screening.
High school diploma, basic math, science and mechanical skills.
Associate or Bachelor’s degree preferred (especially science, engineering or related ﬁeld).
Experience in industrial maintenance, mechanical, laboratory, ﬁeld science, etc. preferred.
Knowledge of EPA source test methods/procedures, air quality or emission monitors, etc. preferred
The above statements are intended to describe the general nature of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of employees so classified.

Sustainability Manager(Job Number: 049479)
Description


Grant Thornton is collaborative, entrepreneurial and on the move. As part of a dynamic global organization of 54,000 people serving clients in more than 140 countries, we have the agility and focus it takes to be a leader.


Sustainability Manager


Position Summaries


Grant Thornton works with some of the country’s most successful private and public companies to first understand their businesses and the risks they face, and then focus our efforts where they matter most.
Our Sustainability professionals provide expertise and guidance across the entire ESG lifecycle, from data gathering, to designing sustainability strategies and providing assurance over a variety of ESG subject matters. Candidates will experience projects across a variety of industries that range from developing key performance indicators across the spectrum of sustainability objectives to auditing sustainability reports.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities


Engage with clients and perform independent research to develop a deep understanding of business risks and opportunities posed by sustainability or ESG matters.
Perform sustainability reporting readiness assessments by first understanding existing corporate activities and then identifying necessary supplemental processes, information systems, procedures and controls needed to achieve desired outcomes.

Perform materiality assessments to identify sustainability issues material to the client and its stakeholders. Identify key metrics or KPIs (from existing sustainability reporting standards) for internal benchmarking, progress measurement and/or external reporting.
Develop and lead external and internal trainings and thought leadership on sustainability topics.

Maintain active communication with clients to manage expectations, ensure satisfaction, and lead change efforts effectively.

Team with others on proposals and business development activities. Understand and manage firm risk on proposals.

Adhere to the highest degree of professional standards, manage firm risk on engagements, and maintain strict client confidentiality.
Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in Sustainability, Climate/Physical Sciences, Environmental Engineering, Economics, Accounting, Business, Political Science, or related disciplines. Master’s degree or MBA is preferred

5+ years of relevant experience with an advisory, financial services firm, ESG rating agency, sustainability role, or other relevant roles with a sustainability or ESG focus. For assurance positions, experience providing audit or attest services in an ESG/sustainability environment.

Strong written and verbal communication, presentation, client service, technical writing skills and research skills.

Advanced skills in PowerBI, Excel and PowerPoint.

Preferred Knowledge Areas

Sustainability / ESG subject-matter knowledge including strategy design, reporting, and sustainability risk management.

GHG emissions, water and waste accounting.

Data and quantitative experience with data aggregation, analytics, visualization, and reporting preferred.

Knowledge of sustainability reporting standards and frameworks such as GRI, CDP, SASB, IIRC, and TCFD; experience using one or more reporting standards preferred.
BENEFITS

Grant Thornton LLP promotes a nationally recognized culture of health and offers an extensive array of benefits to meet individual lifestyles. For a complete list of company benefits, please visit www.gt.com.

Founded in Chicago in 1924, Grant Thornton LLP (Grant Thornton) is the U.S. member firm of Grant Thornton International Ltd., one of the world’s leading organizations of independent audit, tax and advisory firms.

It is Grant Thornton’s policy to promote equal employment opportunities. All personnel decisions, including, but not limited to, recruiting, hiring, training, promotion, compensation, benefits and termination, are made without regard to race, creed, color, religion, national origin, sex, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, citizenship status, veteran status, disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local law.

For Los Angeles Applicants only: We will consider for employment all qualified Applicants, including those with Criminal Histories, in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable state and local laws, including the City of Los Angeles’ Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance.

Primary Location - US-New York-New York
Other Locations - US-Texas-Dallas, US-CA-San Francisco, US-MA-Boston, US-CA-Los Angeles, US-IL-Chicago, US-District of Columbia-Washington
Work Locations - New York - Manhattan(641) 757 3rd Avenue #9 New York 10017
