The following are REQUIRED:
2+ years of project management experience (agency, consultancy, or creative environments preferred)
Experience in delivering web, mobile and/or new product launch projects from start to completion
Experience in working across all levels of the organization from C Level to entry level, leveraging interpersonal relationship skills in complex customer environment (ability to manage up)
Mastery of Project Management Software (e.g. Asana, Basecamp, JIRA, Hive, Trello, Zoho, etc.)

Ability to collaborate with and motivate teams

Why GreenPrint
We are mission-based business that believes in driving a triple bottom line. We enable businesses to do well, by doing good through the turnkey sustainability services we provide. Due to huge market potential, GreenPrint made the INC 5000 fastest growing companies in 2019 debuting at number #71 overall, #2 in the energy category and #3 in Atlanta. Last year, together with our partners we offset over 2 million metric tons of harmful carbon from being emitted into the air and planted over 200,000 trees across the globe.

job_title: Restricted Substances & Product Disclosure Project Manager
job_descriptions:
We are looking for a talented Restricted Substances & Product Disclosure Project Manager to join our team specializing in Environment for our Corporate Business Unit in Columbus, IN
In this role, you will make an impact in the following ways:
Applies highly specialized knowledge of technical principles and practices to assigned areas and projects by interpreting, communicating and ensuring all environmental regulations and standards are adhered to as they impact the company products, processes, components or facilities.
Leads strategy and execution for initiatives focused on emissions compliance, materials compliance, facilities compliance, pollution prevention or resource conservation.
Responsible for leading, implementing and supporting key projects targeted at improving environmental compliance for products or facilities.
Leads and supports the development and dissemination of policies, programs, tools and practices to manage environmental or compliance risk and leverage opportunity. Identify improvement opportunities and drive solutions to address these opportunities.
Leads defining and and executing corrective actions and sets strategic direction for a program, technical or discipline. Advises and transfers knowledge of environmental discipline; coach and mentor less experienced practitioners.
Makes critical project or product related decisions. Collaborates with industry peers within their discipline.
Drives and manages system level requirements for projects or programs.
Performs as the local technical expert for one or more engineering or environmental specialties. Solves complex problems impacting multiple projects.
Provides consulting services on environmental or compliance issues. Champion the development of environmentally sustainable business practices. Communicates with and influences key external stakeholders and business leaders, escalates compliance issues as appropriate.
Communicates metrics progress, potential issues and mitigation plans to key stakeholders at multiple levels, including management review groups, executive sponsors, implementation partners and others.
Monitors and measures overall environmental and compliance performance; analyzes results and proposes solutions to identified risks and opportunities.

Responsible for leading, implementing, prioritizing and supporting large or multiple compliance projects, utilizing sound project management skills to manage the scope, cost and quality of the implementation defined project objectives.
Supports end-users in their efforts to understand environmental requirements. Collaborates with other functions, disciplines and teams to ensure requirements are met.
Qualifications
To be successful in this role you will need the following:
Environmental Acumen - Leverages environmental topics and trends related to air, exhaust, water, waste, sustainability, and/or materials; uses environmental data to solve problems, understand business impact, protect and improve the environment while also making a positive impact in human health and well-being.
Regulatory Compliance - Illustrates knowledge of regulatory requirements by identifying compliance issues in daily work; develops and documents mitigation plans that take into account Cummins’ culture to address identified issues to ensure compliance and reduce risks for Cummins and its shareholders.
Manages complexity - Making sense of complex, high quantity, and sometimes contradictory information to effectively solve problems.
Collaborates - Building partnerships and working collaboratively with others to meet shared objectives.
Instills trust - Gaining the confidence and trust of others through honesty, integrity, and authenticity.
Compensation and Benefits
Base salary rate commensurate with experience. Additional benefits vary between locations and include options such as our 401(k) Retirement Savings Plan, Cash Balance Pension Plan, Medical/Dental/Life Insurance, Health Savings Account, Domestic Partners Coverage and a full complement of personal and professional benefits.
Cummins and E-Verify
At Cummins, we are an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer dedicated to diversity in the workplace. Our policy is to provide equal employment opportunities to all qualified persons without regard to race, gender, color, disability, national origin, age, religion, union affiliation, sexual orientation, veteran status, citizenship, gender identity and/or expression, or other status protected by law. Cummins validates right to work using E-Verify. Cummins will provide the Social Security Administration (SSA) and, if necessary, the Department of Homeland Security (DHS), with information from each new employee’s Form I-9 to confirm work authorization.

job_title: General Manager, Purchasing and Sustainability, University Dining Services
job_descriptions:
Supervises classified employees (e.g., Receiving and Distribution Clerks, Stores Clerks, Storekeepers, Delivery Workers) engaged in receiving and/or distribution operations; coordinates receipt, inspection, storage and distribution of food, supplies, and equipment; maintains computerized inventory and related records. Oversee and manage key aspects of Kent State Universities residence life business operations, including vendor relationships, purchasing and pricing, vending program, project management support and environmental sustainability efforts.

Additional Basic Function – if applicable:


Examples of Duties:

Duties/essential functions may include, but not be limited to, the following:

Supervise classified employees (e.g., Receiving and Distribution Clerks, Stores Clerks, Storekeepers, Delivery Workers) and student or temporary employees engaged in receiving and/or distribution operations as well as sustainability initiatives.

Manage the selection and purchasing process for auxiliary operations, ensuring high levels of quality and

financial goals are met.

Source, review, recommend and incorporate new products as necessary. Collaborate with Campus Executive Chef on products and ingredients with culinary applications.

Maintain and control margins through negotiating costs with vendors and recommending retail prices.

Participate in the review and approval of new vendors, products, RFPs and contracts.

Assist in on-boarding of new contracted and sole-source vendors; maintain relationships by meeting regularly to review vendor performance, cost changes, additional accounts, sales volume and overall communication between our food service operations and the vendor.

Focus on building environmentally sustainable purchases (majority of overall purchases).

Establish and review yearly forecasted purchase order amounts for vendors.

Identify and collaborate with key stakeholders to implement process efficiencies; track impact and savings.

Create/update price bench marking and monitor year over year price changes, making annual recommendations.

Creation, implementation and compliance of vendor order guides and pricing, key to holding vendors and

operators accountable.

Manage the sustainable food systems efforts, coordinate, lead and participate in campus sustainability events and committees for auxiliary services.

Oversee the sustainable waste management efforts of Dining striving for zero waste through composting,

recycling and landfill waste diversion.

Collaborate with Senior Leadership to develop and maintain plan for Capital Reserves spending.

Oversee the compostables purchasing aspect of Dining’s take-out business.

Participate in approved programs with organizations such as the National Association of College and University Food Services (NACUFS) as directed.

Perform related duties as required.

Additional Examples of Duties – if applicable:

Bachelor’s Degree in hospitality or related field. A minimum of three years progressively responsible experience in inventory control and receiving and distribution operations to include prior experience as a lead worker or supervisor over receiving and distribution operations.

Valid Ohio driver's license with safe driving record.

Knowledge Of:

Industrial safety practices
Inventory control computer systems
Receiving and distribution procedures
Inventory control

Written communication (e.g., to write instructions and specifications concerning inventory)
Interpersonal communication to effectively interact with University personnel and public in person and over the telephone (e.g., to transmit work directives, to arrange times to pick up donations, to coordinate movement of equipment from one area to another)

Ability To:

Supervise, interview, evaluate, discipline, and train employees
Plan and direct work activities, to manage time effectively, and set priorities
Understand system of bookkeeping procedures
Define problems, collect data, establish facts and draw valid conclusions Read and comprehend a variety of written material
Perform basic mathematics (e.g., add, subtract, multiply, and divide whole numbers, fractions, and decimals, and to Calculate percentages)
Gather, collate, and classify information
Operate a computer for data entry/retrieval

Company Overview:
FMC Corporation is a leading specialty company focused on agricultural technologies. FMC provides innovative and cost-effective solutions to enhance crop yield and quality by controlling a broad spectrum of insects, weeds and disease, as well as in non-agricultural markets for pest control.

FMC is a globally diverse organization that offers its employees exciting opportunities to work on challenging projects that are important to the achievement of our strategic objectives. Your education and professional experience are valued and put to use from day one. Your success at completing key initiatives can result in a varied, progressive and fulfilling career with FMC.

With a corporate culture of innovation, integrity, responsibility and customer intimacy, we foster “The Right Chemistry” in everything we do. We are looking for people to join us in creating, developing, and improving our products, our processes, and our markets. If you are ready to make a difference every day, FMC is ready to talk to you.
Overview:

The sustainability environmental engineer will report to the global sustainability director. This position will serve as the environmental subject matter expert (SME) and be responsible for technical data gathering, analysis and application. This role will also serve to support business functions as they integrate sustainability into their core activities such as technical center efficiency initiatives, capital deployment, procurement and supplier engagement.
Responsibilities:
Lead the sustainability environmental data management process, including the software data collection system and maintenance of the system through the software vendor, as well as collaborating with site personnel and operations to ensure accuracy of the metrics.
Engage with internal stakeholders in order to identify, prioritize and implement sustainability related initiatives to reduce overall environmental footprint. Areas of focus include greenhouse gases (GHG), energy use, water use and waste generation.
Lead cross functional team to develop and implement a comprehensive renewable energy strategy.
Monitor industry best practices in strategy and resource efficiency coupled with a strong curiosity for continuous improvement.
Report on environmental metric and highlight the programs that drive the results.
Baseline scope 3 emissions and develop a reduction strategy aligned with overall climate change goals.
Required Education:
Engineering degree with preference focus on chemical, environmental or sustainability.
Master’s degree a plus.
Qualifications:
At least 5 - 7 years of experience in a similar role, ideally within the chemical industry leading cross-functional teams.
Experience in environmental efficiency initiatives, energy management and Life Cycle Analysis (LCA) assessments.
Extensive project management experience,
Competent computer skills (Microsoft Office, etc.)
Strong analytical skills and the ability to read and analyze complex data.
Ability to communicate clearly and concisely, both orally and written, and explain technical concepts or innovations to technical and non-technical employees.
Approximately 10% travel required

NEIMAN MARCUS GROUP
Neiman Marcus Group (NMG) has been the premier destination for luxury fashion and goods, superior service, and an elevated retail experience for more than a century. Today, 9,000 associates contribute to the success of NMG’s brands: Neiman Marcus, Bergdorf Goodman, Last Call, and Horchow. There are 38 full-line Neiman Marcus stores in cosmopolitan markets across the United States and a sophisticated digital platform that attracts shoppers worldwide. Bergdorf Goodman operates two stores in landmark locations on Fifth Avenue in New York City and BergdorfGoodman.com, catering to loyal luxury customers globally. NMG also owns five Last Call stores and Horchow.com, an e-commerce site that offers premium furniture and home decor.
As an organization, NMG is on a transformational journey to become the preeminent luxury customer platform. NMG continues to deliver the best integrated customer experience and has evolved the business to succeed in the ever-changing retail landscape. NMG is a relationship business. What differentiates the organization from other luxury retailers are its unique assets: a strong store footprint, the most knowledgeable associates, an engaging online experience, solid brand partnerships, innovative digital and in-store experiences, the most loyal luxury customer base, and a strong balance sheet.
Our customers will always be at the center of everything NMG does. The company continues to reinvest in new technologies that enhance the customer experience. NMG meets customers where they are. NMG’s goal is to offer customers a seamless experience across its stores, online, and remote digital selling.
NMG’s priority is to develop a highly engaged and high-performing team where everyone belongs. The business attracts and retains best-in-class talent through unique offerings provided to associates in addition to standard employer benefits. These include an innovative way of working, associate discounts on merchandise, tuition reimbursement, associate hardship fund, and paid time off to volunteer, to name a few.

job_title: Postdoctoral Researcher – Process modeling and sustainability analysis for biomass conversion and plastics upcycling
job_descriptions:
Posting Title
Postdoctoral Researcher – Process modeling and sustainability analysis for biomass conversion and plastics upcycling
.
Location
CO - Golden
.
Position Type
Postdoc (Fixed Term)
.
Hours Per Week
40
.
Job Description
The National Renewable Energy Laboratory (NREL) in Golden, Colorado, is the nation's primary laboratory for research, development, and deployment of renewable energy and energy efficiency technologies. The NREL mission is to develop renewable energy and energy efficient technologies and practices, advance related science and engineering, and transfer knowledge and innovation to address the nation’s energy and environmental goals. The Catalytic Carbon Transformation & Scale-Up Center at NREL has an opening for a full time Postdoctoral Researcher within the Economic, Sustainability, and Market Analysis group. The initial appointment is for one year, with possible renewal up to three years.
This position will work on two primary analysis projects, both with Aspen Plus and other process modeling tools, integrated into techno-economic analysis (TEA). The first is part of the Center for Bioenergy Innovation (CBI), in which we are developing new approaches to cost-effectively convert biomass into realistic biofuels. The successful candidate will work closely with the CBI Lignin Valorization team to conduct biorefinery analyses related to lignin valorization to fuels and chemicals. Analyses will be used to guide experimental R&D and thus a close connection to experimental efforts will be critical.
Secondly, the successful candidate will work in the BOTTLE Consortium, wherein we are conducting research aimed at upcycling today’s plastics using chemical and biological catalysis and designing tomorrow’s plastics to be recyclable-by-design. This position will focus on techno-economic analysis to baseline today’s manufacturing processes for plastics and to compare those to new chemical and biological recycling approaches. This position will specifically focus on the analysis of detailed process models to baseline the business-as-usual cases for commodity plastics manufacturing, and to write high-impact publications for the chemistry and engineering communities against which to compare innovative concepts in plastics upcycling. Work with a dynamic, multi-disciplinary experimental and modeling team will be a critical component of this position, and analysis will be expected to guide experimental research efforts.
The successful candidate will be able to:
Assimilate a wide variety of information into assessments
Contribute to the planning and execution of research and analysis
Communicate scientific results effectively, both written and oral
Author peer-reviewed publications.
Work effectively in a large, multidisciplinary team of engineers, chemists, and biologists.
.
Basic Qualifications
Must be a recent, related PhD graduate within the last three years.
.
Additional Required Qualifications
Research experience with an emphasis on chemical process development, including biomass conversion and/or plastics manufacturing.
Demonstrated experience with process modeling in Aspen Plus and associated TEA methodologies.
Demonstrated experience with doing statistical analysis (ie sensitivity or uncertainty).
PhD degree in chemical engineering or related field.
Preferred Qualifications
Understanding of current (petroleum) refinery processes.
Understanding of biomass conversion research and processes.
Experience in polymer synthesis or use.
Relevant experience with sustainable materials and practices.
Demonstrated experience with programming codes such as Python or R.
Demonstrated experience with LCA tools such as openLCA or SimaPro.
Understanding of current (petroleum) refinery processes.
Understanding of biomass conversion research and processes.
Relevant experience with sustainable materials and green chemistry practices.
.
Annual Salary Range (based on full-time 40 hours per week)
Annual Salary Range: $68,000 - $112,200
Of fers will typically be made in the bottom half of the listed range. NREL takes into consideration a candidate’s education, training, and experience, as well as the position's work location, expected quality and quantity of work, required travel (if any), external market and internal value, including seniority and merit systems, and internal pay alignment when determining the salary level for potential new employees. In compliance with the Colorado Equal Pay for Equal Work Act, a potential new employee’s salary history will not be used in compensation decisions.
Benefits Summary
Benefits include medical, dental, and vision insurance; short-term disability insurance*; pension benefits*; 403(b) Employee Savings Plan with employer match*; life and accidental death and dismemberment (AD&D) insurance; personal time off (PTO) and sick leave; and paid holidays. NREL employees may be eligible for, but are not guaranteed, performance-, merit-, and achievement- based awards that include a monetary component. Some positions may be eligible for relocation expense reimbursement.
* Based on eligibility rules
Submission Guidelines
Please note that in order to be considered an applicant for any position at NREL you must submit an application form for each position for which you believe you are qualified. Applications are not kept on file for future positions. Please include a cover letter and resume with each position application.
.
EEO Policy
NREL is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard basis of age (40 and over), color, disability, gender identity, genetic information, marital status, military or veteran status, national origin/ancestry, race, religion, creed, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding), sexual orientation, and any other applicable status protected by federal, state, or local laws.

The Sustainability department is responsible for developing the sustainability strategy and plans for NYPA and the Canal Corp., managing performance and preparing annual reports. The Sustainability program aligns with and supports the strategic vision and New York State’s ambitious climate and energy goals. The Sustainability Project Manager is responsible for supporting NYPA’s strategic initiatives and managing climate and energy-related programs. Responsibilities may include: creating a comprehensive greenhouse gas inventory and analyzing opportunities to reduce NYPA and Canals carbon footprint across the value chain; managing climate adaptation and resilience assessments and working with teams to implement strategies across the organization; and managing building and vehicle fleet efficiency and electrification projects, including identifying opportunities to demonstrate advanced technology solutions.

The Sustainability Project Manager is expected to serve as a strategic sustainability advisor to business units and departments across the organization on climate and energy programs, providing guidance and analytical support in defining goals, targets and metrics, identifying strategies, developing projects, and measuring and reporting progress. Responsibilities vary by project and may include research, preparation of reports and presentations, and development of training resources.

The Sustainability Project Manager is expected to be well-organized, exhibit a keen attention to detail, and display a strong interest in finding ways drive strategic Sustainability goals and to optimize data gathering and reporting processes where needed.

Responsibilities
Manage projects across business units and departments: define project scope, strategize and prioritize project resources; develop detailed work plans, and lead project teams involving multiple stakeholders.
Support stakeholders in planning and project development, including identification and assessment of goals, targets, and strategies.
Monitor progress to make sure milestones are being met across the various projects.
Perform special/advanced analyses as directed.
Develop tools and resources for data and performance management.
Research and analyze industry data to support the development of strategies, policies, and projects.
Participate in internal and external working groups and committees and represent the Sustainability group on working groups and committees as needed.
Coordinate inter-departmental initiatives and overseeing and/or supporting the work of project teams.
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
Exceptional analytical and quantitative skills, including proficiency in statistical and cost/benefit analysis.Ability to establish strategic benchmarks, develop past and future performance trends, and make recommendations regarding targets and KPIs.Excellent organizational and project management skills; ability to handle significant workload with multiple projects, timelines, and due dates.Knowledge of formal project management practices, such as Project Management Institute (PMI) preferred.Self-motivated with demonstrated ability to work independently, prioritize among competing needs and proactively address issues.Resourceful with demonstrated ability to manage complex problems and recommend solutions.Demonstrated ability to work in teams and provide guidance and feedback to others.Excellent verbal, written and presentation skills; ability to summarize complicated matters for a variety of audiences.Advanced knowledge of energy, climate, and sustainability (environmental, social, governance and economic) issues.Advanced knowledge of corporate sustainability and sustainable operations.

Education, Experience and Certifications
Bachelor’s Degree in sustainability, engineering, environmental science, economics, or related field.
Graduate degree in sustainability or related field preferred.
Minimum 4 years of experience in data analytics or project management.
Minimum 2 years of direct experience in corporate sustainability and sustainable operations.
Energy/utility industry experience preferred.
Proficiency in Excel
Physical Requirements
Approximately 25% travel primarily within New York State.

Description
Agri Beef is a family owned and operated company rooted in the heart of the Northwest. Originally founded in 1968, the company has expanded into a vertically integrated beef production model to include every process of the beef lifecycle including ranching, feeding and processing. Agri Beef has operations throughout Idaho and Washington, each integrally involved in producing the highest quality beef for Agri Beef’s branded beef programs; Snake River Farms, Double R Ranch, St. Helens, and Rancho El Oro. Agri Beef operates under the guiding principles of sustainability, total quality, animal well-being and responsibility to employees, the community and the industry and believes in building a team that is inspired by purpose and driven by perfection.
Agri Beef’s feedyards employ some of the most dedicated people in the business. To ensure our cattle are cared for properly and given a healthy, comfortable environment, our people manufacture and deliver feed, provide care for our animals, maintain our facilities and equipment, and provide administrative support to our teams and customers. Our Boise Valley feedyard is in Parma, Idaho and the primary goal of our feedyard is to maintain optimal health and well-being of our animals.
We are looking for a Pen Rider at our cattle feedyard in Parma, Idaho. As a member of our Cattle Processing & Health team, you will handle, move, inspect, doctor, process and retrieve cattle in a quiet and efficient manner.

Duties & Responsibilities

Prepares cattle for receiving into the feedyardRide (horseback) and/or walk through pens, inspect cattle and evaluate compromised animals for treatmentAdministers injections and or other treatments according to protocolDiagnoses and treats cattleEnsures compliance to the company Animal Well-Being Policy and GuidelinesMUST PROVIDE OWN HORSES AND TACK

Requirements
High school diploma or general education degree (GED) preferred
One year related cattle handling experience or training required.
Must be a skilled rider and knowledge to identify animal illness.

Company Overview
Fanatics is the global leader in licensed sports merchandise and changing the way fans purchase their favorite team apparel and jerseys. Through an innovative, tech-infused approach to making and selling fan gear in today's on-demand culture, Fanatics operates more than 300 online and offline stores, including the e-commerce business for all major professional sports leagues (NFL, MLB, NBA, NHL, NASCAR, MLS, PGA), and more than 200 collegiate and professional team properties, which include several of the biggest global soccer clubs (Manchester United, Real Madrid, Chelsea). Fanatics offers the largest collection of timeless and timely merchandise whether shopping online, on your phone, in stores, in stadiums or on-site at the world's biggest sporting events. At Fanatics, we’re a diverse, passionate group of employees aiming to ignite pride and passion in the fans we outfit, celebrate and support. We recognize that diversity helps drive and foster innovation, and through our IDEA program (inclusion, diversity, equality and advocacy) at Fanatics we provide employees with tools and resources to feel connected and engaged in who they are and what they do to support the ultimate fan experience.

At Fanatics, our Business Affairs & Legal team plays an integral role into why we are the #1 licensed sports, omni-channel retailer. This team is known for negotiating and drafting long-term, exclusive deals with professional sports teams, universities, event promoters, and athletes. They are trusted advisors in counseling our business teams with day-to-day matters as well as key strategic initiatives. This division is critical to the success of the overall company strategy and our mission to become the #1 Fan Brand in the world.
Fanatics is seeking a motivated, team-oriented lawyer with 2-5 years of transactional law experience (law firm experience preferred, in-house experience not required) in Tampa. The Assistant Legal Counsel will report to the Associate General Counsel, Fanatics Brands and provide support across the Global Legal Team.

Primarily supports the Fanatics Brands business on global matters

Renders opinions and advice regarding the interpretation of contract provisions, intellectual property laws, and other business law issues including corporate organization, mergers and acquisitions and governance
Performs legal research and analysis in preparation for litigation or other legal actions. Examines pertinent information (e.g., interview notes, historical precedent, etc.) to determine advisability of defending or prosecuting litigation
Acts as advisor on legal issues concerning legal rights, obligations, and privileges
Coordinates legal matters handled by outside counsel

Requires a law degree, such as a Juris Doctor or other comparable degree, and admission to practice law
Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:
Demonstrated experience in general corporate matters including corporate organization, securities compliance, drafting transactional documents, M&A, license agreements, employment law, intellectual property, regulatory matters, risk management, asset-backed financing, and contract management
Experience in trade secrets, advertising law, registration, and other resolutions specific to the computer and technology industry as well as SEC reporting
Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to tailor messages to be appropriate to the audience and avoid technical jargon

Overview:

About Central Coast Agriculture:
Headquartered north of Santa Barbara in the heart of the Santa Ynez Valley, CCA is a company
focused on utilizing science and sustainability to grow quality, modern crops. Our unmatched
commitment to innovating both organic farming and modern manufacturing means our
customers have access to products that exceed expectations.
We breed, grow, and cultivate the highest quality cannabis so we can then process, manufacture,
and package the highest quality single-source products on the market under our brand, Raw
Garden.
We are a team of change makers, modern farmers, scientists, and business professionals focused
on leading the charge for agricultural innovation.
We are on a mission to be the most trusted and loved brand in Cannabis.
About The Role:
As a Process Development Research Associate, you will play an Engineer/Scientist-assistant
role. You will be the assistant in cannabis biomass handling, extraction, and refinement for the
R&D team. Your role will include supporting New Product Development projects along with
researching activities to better understand process parameters to improve efficiency of existing
operations involving Cannabis plant materials, in-process materials, and finished products. In
this role, you will assist in the operation of new or prototype equipment to enable new product
development.
Responsibilities:

What You'll Do
Ensure that safety is first priority in everything you do
Support R&D activities for new process/product development.
Assist in the development of methods for evaluating process efficiencies of raw materials, in-process materials, and finished products. These methods will directly correlate to product attributes valued by our Consumer.
Data collection, organization, and note taking for the purpose of product development
Operate equipment in a fully functional pilot lab for trialing new process improvements, new product development and production environments.
Instill and implement Good Lab Practices, keeping a clean and safe laboratory.
Learn and understand processes throughout R&D to better assist with troubleshooting, determining root cause, and improving work processes.
Ensure that safety is first priority in everything you do.
Prioritize work in a fast-paced environment to limit downtime and keep operations moving.
Work with the highest attention to detail and data integrity.
Maintain professionalism and live CCA’s core values at all times
Perform all other duties as assigned or inherent to the position
Qualifications:

What You'll Need to Have
Position Requirements:
Bachelor's Degree in Chemical/Process Engineering or Chemistry with 1 year’s relevant work experience or 4+ years direct experience in Cannabis biomass handling, extraction, and refinement required.
Hands-on experience and knowledge of plant biomass handling, extraction, and refinement processes, equipment, controls, and operations.
Experience in a pilot plant environment with knowledge of requirements to qualify processes for transfer to Manufacturing.
Experience in a Cannabis product Manufacturing environment
Strong analytical skills. Demonstrate attention to detail and accuracy.
Knowledge of good laboratory best practices, including sample prep, handling, data recording, and record keeping.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and prioritize work while multitasking.
Demonstrate motivation and a good work ethic under minimal supervision.
Must work effectively in team environments.
Statistical process control skills and use of statistical analysis software required.
Highly collaborative and have excellent interpersonal skills.
Able to work independently and “roll up your sleeves” to make things happen.
Must possess a high degree of creativity in design and engineering to solve problems with equipment and materials at hand.
High intensity team player who thrives in a fast paced, dynamic environment.
Constantly questioning the way things are done in a constructive manner and thrives on change that improves results.
Experience with lean or six sigma process improvement frameworks a plus.
Open (no agendas), honest and trustworthy.
Results oriented individual with a desire to manage change through to fruition.
Ability to prioritize and manage multiple projects at one time.
Intermediate user of Microsoft Office and/or Google’s G suite.
Functional knowledge of California cannabis regulations.
Must be 21 years of age (or older) at the time of hire.
Proficiency of the English language, verbal and written format.
What You'll Receive
Competitive base salary
Medical, dental and vision benefits
Vacation and Holidays

At Beyond Meat, we started with simple questions. Why do you need an animal to create meat? Why can’t you build meat directly from plants? Thus, we make plant-based meats that allow families to eat more, not less, of the traditional dishes they love while feeling great about the health, sustainability, and animal welfare benefits of plant protein. Our goal is to bring exciting change to the plate—and Beyond.
OVERVIEW
The product certification manager is solely responsible for ensuring that all products produced by Beyond Meat or one of it’s contract manufacturing partners is certified by approved certifying bodies. This role is responsible for staying current on all requirements for the approved certifying bodies and for communicating any changes cross-functionally to internal and external stakeholders. This role will create processes to collect, review and approve new and existing ingredients and products in a timely manner to support rapid relentless innovation and launch of new products.


RESPONSIBILITIES
Collect, review, approve and process ALL new and existing ingredient to ensure compliance with approved certifying bodies, including but not limited to
Non-GMO Project Verified
Vegan Action
Vegetarian Society, Vegan certified
Halal
Kosher
Communicates cross functionally on status of certification for new and existing ingredients and/or products to ensure risks are identified and acted on.
Ensure that all internal and external manufacturing sites as well as warehouse and distribution sites are operating in compliance with all CB requirements and have appropriate documentation to comply with routine audits
QUALIFICATIONS
BA or BS degree in food science, nutrition or applicable professional experience
Experience working in a highly regulated environment for a minimum of 5 years
Skills:
Ability to work with a cross functional team to drive results
Strong PC skills includes MS office programs
Excellent interpersonal, communication, problem solving, and organizational skills
Abilities:
Ability to collect, review and prioritize large volumes of information under extremely tight timelines in support of a large project or initiative
Ability to effectively present information to groups and respond to questions from all levels in the organization
Ability to dive deep on complex subjects and synthesize information into actionable insights
Other qualifications:
Must be able to work with a computer keyboard and screen for long periods of time.
WORK ENVIRONMENT
Office environment with routine visits to manufacturing, warehouse and distribution sites.

Job Locations: US-NC-BLADENBORO Your Opportunity:

The Herdsperson assists other Herd Technicians in routine animal care and general farm tasks to ensure the welfare/well-being of the animals. Tasks include farm sanitation, animal removal, and animal movement. Employee may operate mowers, tractors, trucks, bus, and other farm equipment as directed. May be in training for advanced Herd Technician designation. The Herdsperson position will also provide for the care of all animals at the designated work site, particularly their health, growth, and breeding.
Core Responsibilities:
Feeds, waters, vaccinates, and performs general animal husbandry tasks including basic veterinary procedures.
Maintains flexibility with a willingness to change plans according to the direction of farm leadership.
Assists in moving animals and maintaining efficient animal flows.
Sanitizes and washes multiple areas on the farm using high pressure equipment.
Processes piglets, which includes: Injecting medications, castrating, docking tails, and ear notching.
Maintains accurate production information and update all department records as required.
Treats sick animals with a variety of pharmaceuticals by injection, oral application, and/or other methods as required.
Follows the Standard Operation Procedures, Production Manuals, or Appropriate Training Guides as required.
Assists with facility and equipment maintenance.
Assists with maintaining barn, office cleanliness, and laundry duties.
Follows the Company’s animal welfare policies and procedures including: providing a physical environment that meets the animal’s needs, providing access to adequate water and high quality feed, providing humane treatment of the animals, providing identification and appropriate treatment of animals in need of health care and following the guidelines for euthanasia.
Responsible for complying with all environmental, safety and biosecurity laws and procedures.
The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this job. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified. May perform other duties as assigned.
Qualifications:

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals to perform the essential functions.
High School diploma or GED preferred.
Previous livestock handing helpful.
Ability to do hard physical labor.
Strong commitment to teamwork.
Willingness to shower daily in and out of facility.
Ability to follow instructions and deal with standardized situations.
Must be able to work an average 48-hour work week, which can vary frequently.
Weekend, evening, and holiday work required as needed.
Must be on call for emergency situations to include but not limit to, power outages or personnel shortages.
Ability to work well with others in fast paced, dynamic environment.
Ability to be respectful, approachable and team oriented while building strong working relationships and a positive work environment.
Work Environment & Physical Demands:

The work environment characteristics & physical demands described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Vision abilities include close vision, distance vision and ability to adjust focus.
Occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 lbs.
Frequently required to stand; walk; use hands to handle or feel; reach with hands and arms; stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl and talk or hear.
Must be able to work with and around a wide range of antibiotics (i.e. penicillin).
Must be able to tolerate blood, animal dander, manure, dust, odors, and frequently noisy conditions.

About Smithfield Foods:

Headquartered in Smithfield, Va. since 1936, Smithfield Foods, Inc. is an American food company with agricultural roots and a global reach. Our 40,000 U.S. and 15,000 European employees are dedicated to producing "Good food. Responsibly.®" and have made us one of the world's leading vertically integrated protein companies. We have pioneered sustainability standards for more than two decades, including many industry firsts, such as our ambitious commitment to cut our carbon impact by 25 percent by 2025. We believe in the power of protein to end food insecurity and have donated hundreds of millions of food servings to our neighbors in need. Smithfield boasts a portfolio of high-quality iconic brands, such as Smithfield®, Eckrich® and Nathan's Famous®, among many others. For more information, visit www.smithfieldfoods.com, and connect with us on Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn and Instagram.
EEO/AA Information:

Smithfield is an equal opportunity employer committed to workplace diversity. Overview

When you join Hines, you will work among innovative leaders who set the standards responsible for our reputation as an industry leader and you will continue to shape our future in the years to come.

Responsibilities

As a Vice President of Conceptual Construction with Hines, you will manage and act as Owner's representative for all activities associated with consultant selection and contract negotiations, site master-planning, design management, preliminary budgeting and scheduling, bid and award and construction contract negotiations. Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

Responsible for new business, development management, and support of local, regional, and country teams in new business activities
Member of the Hines Conceptual Construction Group, which coordinates general preconstruction activities. Responsible for selection and contract negotiations of consultants. Manages architects/engineers work as to site master planning and design, budget and schedule, plus direct activities of architects/engineers
Manages the preparation of cost estimates, budgets and budget updates, reviews design and working drawings
Assists Hines local and regional construction management team as a resource during construction
Assist in new business and marketing presentations to equity partners and clients
Coordinates preconstruction activity with Hines development team
Ensures compliance with all applicable laws and codes, and Hines' standards
Assists in preparation and monitoring of the project budget plus capital improvement project projections
Assists in drawing and specification reviews
Interfaces with Hines Office of innovation team for new technology initiatives on behalf of the Conceptual Construction Group and firm-wide
Performs other duties as assigned by the Senior Vice President of Conceptual Construction or applicable Hines Country Head on project

Qualifications

Minimum Requirements include:

Bachelor's degree from an accredited institution
Ten or more years experience in Construction with a specific focus on Residential/Living projects
Experience in commercial/office, industrial, and/or tenant improvement projects preferred (but not a requirement)
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Strong management and presentation skills
Hines is a privately owned global real estate investment firm founded in 1957 with a presence in 225 cities in 25 countries. Hines has approximately $144.1 billion¹ of assets under management, including $75.5 billion for which Hines serves as investment manager, including non-real estate assets, and $68.6 billion for which Hines provides third-party property-level services. The firm has 165 developments currently underway around the world. Historically, Hines has developed, redeveloped or acquired 1,426 properties, totaling over 472 million square feet. The firm's current property and asset management portfolio includes 576 properties, representing over 246 million square feet. With extensive experience in investments across the risk spectrum and all property types, and a pioneering commitment to sustainability, Hines is one of the largest and most-respected real estate organizations in the world. Visit www.hines.com for more information. ¹AUM includes both the global Hines organization as well as RIA AUM.

Symetra is seeking a Senior Privacy Analyst to join our Enterprise Compliance Department!
About the role
This position will help manage privacy program initiatives and responsibilities across the company. This includes establishing, enhancing, and maintaining our privacy controls and reporting mechanisms. Knowledge of privacy compliance matters as it relates to a life insurance company will be important to undertake day-to-day activities and responsibilities.
Your responsibilities
Interpret privacy requirements, legal regulations, and industry best practices to identify relevant impact to business and technology initiatives
Lead privacy investigations to determine if internal and external incidents meet state notification thresholds while collaborating with different business units
Assist in the implementation of various state and federal privacy regulatory requirements
Demonstrate knowledge of privacy requirements and best practices, and understand how they apply to business practices, operations, and projects
 Develop new and improve existing metrics and reporting tools
Facilitate related privacy and HIPAA training and content delivery
 Document various Compliance decisions on privacy controls and implement controls throughout the enterprise
You will report to the Privacy Officer and work with a Privacy Program Manager to champion the program’s efforts for privacy compliance.
What we offer
We don’t take a “one-size-fits-all” approach when it comes to our employees. Our programs are designed to make your life better both at work and at home.

Wellness program offering employees a variety of resources crafted to assist you in reaching and maintaining your optimum health
Paid time away options to accommodate your needs and life’s events, including vacation (our favorite), illness, caring for a family member, volunteering, the birth or adoption of a child and more

Give back to your community and double your impact through our company matching and/or participate in our company-wide week of service each June

Your education, skills and experience
2+ years of experience in Privacy as a Senior Analyst, Analyst, or in a similar role with directly related compliance experience
Directly related compliance experience will be helpful
Prior experience and knowledge of laws and trends affecting US and global privacy, policy and compliance such as: State Data Breach Notification laws, State Data Protection Laws, GLBA, HIPAA, CCPA, GDPR, etc.
Excellent communication, written and analytical skills that demonstrate the ability to distill complex challenges into actionable solutions
High level of personal integrity and confidentiality
Demonstrated ability to perform and document detailed privacy research and synthesize advice into concise summaries
Demonstrated ability to identify relevant facts (and separate irrelevant facts) and apply a governing legal framework or policy

The role will provide support our corporate office and on-site teams in reliably gathering and managing environmental performance data to support the creation of an Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) report forSack Properties. The intern will partner with internal departments, including PropertyManagement and Capital Improvements, as well as on-site management teams in collecting and organizing key environmental sustainability information to help SackProperties meet evolving disclosure expectations of investors, partners, residents, and other stakeholders.
